This is without doubt the best happy hour I ever have here in Vegas as we as in Los Angeles. If you go to this place please try the burrata! It s AMAZING, great quality. Beer is very good as well ! I ll come back for sure!!!
Nice service at the bar. Those happy hour sliders were good, but tiny (as in 2-3 bites max). The PBJ Old Fashioned was smoothe and tasty. Their Sucker Punch drink was my fave.

Staff is nice, friendly and knowledgeable. Ask for Zach at the bar. He'll dominate your taste buds with some delicious drinks. He's also a really friendly and helpful guy. Peter Rabbit was the best.  Once you're done with your drinks, order some Brussels Sprouts. I'm not actually a big fan of Brussels Sprouts, but they flavor these things to perfection. Calamari is thick and juicy. From what I'm told, they don't use the tentacles, they only use the real meat which is why it's so thick and tender.   For entrees you can't go wrong with any of the meat. Next time I'm going to try the Ribeye although it's a little spendy at 75 bones. But you get what you pay for and I'm a Peter Luger loyalist so I'm willing to pay for a solid steak.  End it off with the red velvet cake and the donuts. Red velvet cake isn't the thick, creamy and rich type that makes you feel fat. It's light, fluffy but still packed with the same amount of flavor. The donuts are soft and warm on the inside and comes with a dip. Awesome.

Four of us had dinner, 2 of us ordered from the Restaurant Week menu, and 2 from the a la carte menu.  Overall the meal was wonderful. The cheddar biscuits were very greasy, cold and almost indelible.  They are thrown on to the table with no explanation as to what they are.  I'd forget these. I ordered a martini with 3 bleu cheese olives, was charged $14.00 for the drink, and to add insult to injury, I was charged $1.00 for the olives.  Very tacky!  One of my dining companions ordered a glass of house Chardonnay.  I'd say $13.00 for a glass of house wine is a bit much. On to the meal.  The food was delicious. I ordered the duck 3 x's, and was told there would be 3 preparations of duck in the plate. I could only find 2, and one was in edible. The sliced duck breast was awesome, but the tiny triangles of crispy skin were too greasy too eat, and quite unpleasant.   The other diners at my table ordered mahi and salmon and were big hits and quite tasty. Two desserts were red velvet cake, which had no discernible taste, but the chocolate mousse was outstanding. The 2 biggest flaws of the evening were asking to pay the $5.00 valet fee as we pulled the car up, and having our plates whisked away from us  as we were still eating.  One of my dining companions wouldn't allow his plate to be taken so the waiter stood there until he finished!  He whisked the plates away as though they needed them for other diners. Not sure I would go back.

Please please please bring back the Lollipop wings!!!!  We literally live locally and come to Searsuxker for Heather (best bartender in Vegas!) and the Lollipop Wings!!!!  We love this place but the wings must come back!!!!!!!!

We couldn't get a seat at Nobu. I remembered how great this place was when I first tried it.  So lucky we got a seat here right away!  Our server was absolutely amazing! Cute petite blonde.  She gave excellent suggestions and got us out in time for our show.    They've taken a few things off the menu since they first opened. Careful not to get your heart set on these amazing Yelp photos. Not to worry, everything is yummy!  They didn't give us any bread so we ordered the biscuits.  Can't go wrong.  Served with butter and honey.   Didn't feel like I was in the mood for her suggested calamari steak.  I am so glad she suggested it!  It was cooked to the perfect texture, firm and tender.  Even the sweet chili sauce that I wasn't thrilled about, paired really well!   We ordered the ribs instead of steak. Good thing our server told us steak would take too long to cook for our time frame.   Super tender atop mashed potatoes.  A few nice onion rings.    Bone marrow.  Comes with a good amount of Brussel sprouts (which I love at this restaurant). Plenty of marrow.  Maybe too much for two girls to eat.     I thoroughly enjoyed every bite of dinner!

I had the most amazing experience at Searsucker last night. I brought my friend Big Mike to one of my favorite spots in Vegas for dinner and drinks and had the greatest experience. I am a frequent visitor of Searsucker and have yet to find anything to complain about. However, in lieu of the incredible service I was lucky to receive last night, I finally felt it necessary to express my gratitude via Yelp.   I usually sit down at a table for dinner when dining here, but Big Mike insisted on sitting at the bar. His decision ended up being the greatest choice we could have made because of the incredibly attentive and friendly service we received from Jen, the coolest bartender I have had the pleasure of interacting with. And trust me, I've had my fair share of benders.   Jen was so genuinely kind and eager to please and make recommendations from the menu. She suggested some dishes I would never have ordered alone, and to my surprise, everything tasted better than ever before.   Big Mike loved Jen so much that he asked me to take his picture with her. She agreed, of course, without a glimmer of doubt in her eye - in the same fashion that she served us all night, in the way she made us feel comfortable - as if we were in the company of an old friend.  Jen made me love Searsucker even more and Big Mike won't stop bugging me about going back. I've never enjoyed eating dinner while sitting at the bar before last night. But if Jen is bartending, you can bet your life that's where I'll be.  So, thanks for being so rad Jen. Thanks for the delicious mixologist style cocktails and thanks for never making us feel like you were working. You look like you're having fun and that's so rare in the industry.   Cheers!   PS Peter Rabbits all night!!!

The $5 parking fee didn't make a good first impression.  Waited for our table at the bar and were served after waiting about 10 minutes.  Then, service from our waiter wasn't much better. The $60 bottle of wine we ordered was bad and he brought us a different wine, his choice,which we enjoyed, but it was $80 when we got our bill!   Food was good but overpriced. Wine list prices were outrageous. Won't be going back.

A short review as I don't have much to say about the restaraunt.  I came here with 8 other people so we ordered a bunch of different appetizers. The Brussel sprouts and the calamari stood out but everything else was very average.  I then went to order the hanger steak. I was fairly disappointed as it was salty and the extremely basic.   The only food I really enjoyed was their dessert. I ordered the chocolate croissant with marshmallows (forgot the actual name). It was amazing and very unique.  For the price, there are much better options in Vegas. I enjoyed Mesa grill much more than Sear... Both are in ceaser's palace.

I LOVE IT HERE! Spectacular service and food from the appetizer to the dessert! I had (shared) the calamari, bone marrow, short ribs, scallops, brussel sprouts, cookies and milk, ice cream sandwiches, and the other one with the marshmallow on top (oh I sound like a pig!). HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Worth the price! Will definitely come back again when visiting
Dinner and drinks with our son and daughter in law and friends.  Fun place.  Located in Caesars.

LOVE.  Duck fat fries.  Mushroom burrata toast.  Grapefruit radler (Steigl).  Anything else after that you're too happy to be thinking clearly, but I assure you it is all delicious and really fun.  One of my favorite places on the Strip, really a perfectly executed endeavor by all involved.

Went there hoping for some small plates we could share , had sliders that were very good. After that all downhill, tuna tacos were tasteless, split a shortrib..not sure how you can make meat that tender bland, someone should introduce the Chef to herbs, vegetables, salt. It was like they braised in tap water and stopped there. Split 2 sides corn and chorizo which was 50% raw tomato, devoid of chorizo. Potatoes with butter...just mashed potatoes, not bad but not great. We won't be back.

The food here is delicious. My friend and I ordered the scallops and decided to share. They originally come with three per plate but our waiter was very sweet and said he would request for four. The scallops were very buttery and flavorful. They were on a bed of couscous with this green lime sauce that I ended up dipping everything in. We also had the brussels spouts that had a great crunch and nutty flavor. We had a side of the corn and it was so sweet and flavorful it went well with everything. It was a great dinner and atmosphere for myself and best friend to enjoy our time at our weekend girl trip in Vegas. Plus, because we dine there we got a token that allowed us to skip the line at Omnia which made our night even more! Truly a great restaurant, food, service and all.

We tried this for dinner tonight and i can honestly say we left with a wide smile and very impressed!  Everything is fresh, in other words the design is nice, the menu is appealing, the staff and and last but not least the food was really good, I highly recommend giving this place a try, it has earned my return business for sure.  We had ahi Tuna and squid (a cool way to serve essentially Calamari) with sweet and sour sauce and remoulade both super fresh and delicious. For entre hanger steak with fingerling potatoes, also perfectly executed.  One other thing to note is the fact that the entire menu is a good value and not overpriced.  Long story short we will be back.

I normally wont blast a restaurant on yelp, but this time I had too, especially when spending a lot of money for a great dining experience, and also at a celebrity chefs restaurant.  We came to Searsucker Las Vegas  on Christmas day. We have been to the one in San Diego for drinks, and it was so good we wanted to try vegas. Well it was disappointing. Especially when the GM of the restaurant is leaning agains the counter by the open kitchen, looking out to the tables while constantly being on his phone. We were there for 2 hours and for the 2 hours he was on his phone and didnt look up or come to any tables. The open kitchen is ment to he a show for the dining guests. Everytime i would look up to watch the show I was so distracted by the eye sore of the main manager engulfed in his phone. Grant it he may have been checking important emails but for goodness sake go off the floor to do so. Very taky. Very unprofessional. When i mentioned this to other people they also experienced the GM on his phone. Bad dining experience wont be back.

We've been back to Searsucker about 4 times and finally after the last time, decided we won't be giving it a second chance. Granted, the first time we went we had really high hopes, but we also were a bit more lenient in our review. The last few times have been so underwhelming. We've likely tried almost everything on the menu now with nothing really standing out-- not even the chicken and waffles (gasp!).   Drink menu sounds interesting in theory but feels more like the illusion of good drinks and not really good drinks.

Service was excellent, the food was interesting and whimsical even.  I enjoyed the pork belly and bone marrow the most among entrees. The emerghard was probably the best sundae I've ever had.  Only quibble is the little bread they bring out wasn't good and I didn't love the duck fat fries as much as I should've given I love duck fat. It's also somewhat pricey but it's the Strip

I honestly don't understand what the rave is about.  The evening started out well enough - we didn't realize we'd need a reservation but was able to sit at one of the high tops near the bar.  The table was wobbly, but the server (busboy?) immediately got down on his knees and readjusted the ends for us.  We started out with the cheddar bites.  They were mini, dense and rather not great.  Its almost like a failure attempt at recreating Red Lobster's cheddar biscuits.  The shrimp and grits were decent, but a far cry from NOLA.  The meat and potatoes were decent, but really average if that.  The duck fat fries were actually pretty good and the only thing we all agreed was tasty.  Too bad the waiter took it away before we were done while talking to another server so we couldn't even protest.  The reasons for the 2 stars - the dishes are creative, the menu is mysterious (which is good and bad), and there was such hope there.  These were the kinds of dishes that you might see on Master Chef or Hell's Kitchen.  But they wouldn't be winners by any means.    The place is kept COLD.  We were near the vents, but still, by the time our food reached our table, they were lukewarm at best.  All in all, the service was inconsistent and the food is mediocre at best.  At such high prices, I'm not sure this will get them a revisit from me.

One of the best new restaurants in Vegas!! Brian Malarkey is a huge rising star in the culinary world. So happy this San Diego restaurant has made its way to Vegas. You've got to try everything you can and share the plates.
Came here for the happy hour to try the Duck fries because I heard they were amazing. They were good, but not the best fries in town. I'll have to come back & try more.

Nice reuse for an existing commercial space; decor is unique and interesting. Floor DJ adds to vibe.   Small plates unique, flavorful, and satisfying; we tried beef tartare, squid, chicken legs, and shrimp plates. Not one dish disappointed. Our one regret is that we did not pace the ordering as the dishes came out all at once and stymied an effort for a relaxing slow meal. Our 2nd regret was eating the complimentary cheddar puffs. Although the puffs were very good, they were also filling and nipped our appetites. The beef tartare was a true highlight with flash fried seaweed, capers, taro chips, and a quail egg.   Service was very friendly, attentive, and down to earth.  Valets definitely need an improved cone and thoroughfare area; it was awkwardly staged and did not have an obvious traffic flow to compliment the restaurant.  Wine menu appeared to be limited to minimum red bottle prices of $50. Hope I overlooked the reasonably priced wines - no one wants to be a sucker!

We had drinks which were very good and we had appetizers.  I picked the chicken, franks and waflle. Delicious-ness! And we had the duck fat fries with tomato jam, which were okay.  I want to go back for dinner. We did see Donovan McNabb have dinner there, so that was kinda cool.

A disappointment. The food was good, and appropriately priced. Tasty cocktails and a nice wine program.  Why two stars? The service. We had an attentive busboy, but that's not the waiter. The waiter was late to the table, so he got the drinks, apps, and meals all at once. The app never came, nor was there water. He offered dessert, but how am I going to want that when there's a late Vegas bight ahead of me?

Oh my God!!!! The food was delectable. We just had the  shared plates . 4 of them between 2 of us and it was enough. Forget about portion size, the fast of each and everyone one of those dishes was exquisite. We had the Calamari, Bone Marrow, Tomato Burrata & olives and Eggs &Bacon. I kid you not that this was the best meal in Vegas !!!

So good I ate here twice.....  I needed a change from all the extremely pretentious spots on Vegas.  I wasn't even staying at caesars but came back after my first experience.   Happy hour old fashions from 5-7 we're legit. You get a nice selection of $9 old fashions and they were all good.....no skimping on the whiskey here.  Also for happy hour, they serve $2 dollar sliders, oysters and bone marrow.  Those selections alone could make a nice dinner.  But.....I also had a full meal....and it was delicious!  Small plates for dining was a great option for us.  Fried pig ears were awesome.  Octopus was awesome.  Short ribs was perfect.  Their poke starters were amazing...served on a fried seaweed chip.  The wings were a pleasant surprised as they were served in a unique way.  There were a few small plates that were ok but the variety we had made up for it.  The bar always had seating even during one of Vegas's busiest conventions. I'm giving this place 4 stars because I actually think I got my money's worth....and that says a lot when you're hanging out in Vegas.

I was invited here through work and it was great! I started off with the adult Arnold Palmer which is sweet tea vodka and lemonade (amazing!) then we had the short rib which was so tender and melts in your mouth! We then had the duck fat fries which were seriously the best fries I've ever had! Then we had the shrimp and grits which is in a red sauce and oh my gosh it's so amazing they come with so much shrimp it's so good! We then had at their signature pork butt entr√©e that came with a Southwestern corn which was so good and other mashed potatoes which was also very very very good! We then topped our meal off with some dessert we had there a banana split which had brownies chocolate ganache a caramelized banana and peanut butter and vanilla and chocolate ice cream which was heaven!! We also had their cookies which came with milk for dunking which I thought was really cute. The meal was amazing we even got to meet the chef and he came to our table introduce himself he's really nice guy.  I will definitely be coming back to this place it's a great place to go to if you don't want anything too formal and nothing too casual right in the middle it's great to go to if you're ready to start your night out in Vegas!

Thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Seasucker.  We made reservations for 8:15pm but needed to push that last minute.  Searsucker was quick to make the change without issue.  We were sat immediately when we arrived.  Our server warmed up after a couple of visits to our goofy table.  Strangely, some drama found Searsucker that night.  As cocktails were being delivered a young lady and her boyfriend started shouting at each other and ran into the back area of the restaurant.  This high level of tense arguing continued until security showed up to usher them out.  Searsucker handled it perfectly.  The good was awesome, best mac-n-cheese I've ever had (that's a BIG statement).  I would go back right now if that were an option.

This place is amazing!! I love it sooo much every time I come here I'm never disappointed with anything. The only thing is I wish sometimes the waiters wrote down their orders even if it's only two people my man and I order a lot and the last couple times they forgot one dish. But other than that the service still is great!!! And the food omg where do I start! The biscuits are a must!!! They take a while but super worth it. I always get the ceviche it's spicy just how I love it. The oysters are good super small but good! We also got the sliders they are ok I wasn't a huge fan but my man loved them! Lastly the tomato soup is a framing must o love it sooo much

I have sensitivities and it is not easy for me to order. This was the third restaurant we tried, while staying at Caesars Palace. With a name like Searsucker-I figured beef only.   Our server was awesome!  He understood my needs and made a fabulous recommendation. The food was great!  I will eat there again. Sadly, I will not stay at Caesars again.

I was really impressed with this place!  The decor is very comfortable and well done to provide a relaxing environment.  The valet was very friendly and the service is excellent too once you arrive in the restaurant.  The food was really very good...the ono with tart cherry was delicious and we tried the whipped potatoes, cauliflower with manchego and the jalapeno corn off the cob...sinful!  The other three diners I was with thoroughly enjoyed their entrees as well - filet, pork chop and duck!  We finished off the meal with the donuts and the deconstructed apple pie...both of which were quite tasty too!

My review is strictly based on the happy hour and frankly, I just wasn't impressed. My friends and I arrived at around 5:30pm and sat in the bar area (which had plenty of empty seating, a plus). We were quickly approached by an unenthused waiter who put off blaring vibes of, "you're not going to tip much so I'm not going to waste my time." We ordered our drinks and they were definitely heavy poured but over priced even for happy hour. The food, however, was pretty good. I ordered the sliders and really enjoyed the sriracha mayo that came with it while my friends ordered the ahi tuna tacos and buffalo chicken pops (FYI, they don't have ranch)  Overall it was a bland experience and bland service (and an awkward "is everything ok here??" by the manager). Their regular menu looked interesting and I'd bet if I returned for an actual meal I would receive better service, but I probably wont return unless someone else was so inclined.

Amazing dinner with a group of friends!  The drink selection was spectacular as well as the food choices. We had 5-6 appetizers they were all good but my favorite was the the bone marrow.  The bone marrow was soft and silky accompanied by an array of different garnish to only accentuate the taste!  I had the short ribs, truly amazing maybe one of the best I've ever had with tangy mashed potatoes.   I can see this for both a group or date night!

Had the seared tuna with greens and the chocolate desert.  Heavenly, a perfect lunch in a great setting.   Love the d√©cor and getting to hear my companion and have a nice conversation without yelling is very special too!  All around, a WooHoo experience.

Happy Hour Daily 5-7pm  Happy Hour Specials are $9 Old Fashioned Cocktails, $5 Beer, $6 Wine, $2-$3 Bar Eats  Happy hour has gone downhill a bit.  Their happy hour menu has shrunk considerably.  No more discounted specialty drinks.  Only cocktails on the menu are 4 old fashioned cocktails.  Food options are oysters, sliders or bone marrow.  It's ok.  I just prefer the old happy hour menu.    Be sure to check out the dessert menu.  There are some great cocktails on there that are not on the regular drink menu.

I have never eaten a full meal in an office building lobby before. I felt like I was eating in an echo chamber at times. The conversion was nicely done. Waitress was outstanding. She knew the menu inside and out. Food was very good. My Pulled Pork was tender enough to cut with a fork. Presentation was fantastic. All side dishes were extra. Very unique menu with lots of items not available in your every day eating establishments like beef tartare, brussels sprouts, etc.

We chose this place because my husband wanted a steak, but we were unimpressed with other steakhouses' reviews and lacked any formal attire. We thought we would give searsucker a try and were pleasantly surprised.  Menu is reasonable, and we started our with potato fries (cooked in duck fat, side of chipotle ketchup). They were fantastic. The ketchup was too hot for my liking, and overpowered the subtle duck flavor, but my husband really liked it.  We ordered the braised ribs for me and the prime New York for my husband. The ribs came on a bed of mashed potatoes with 3 onion rings on top. The potatoes were supposed to be horseradish, but good for me they were not. The first bites were magnificent and I would absolutely get them again. Tender, rich, and flavorful!  My husband ordered his steak medium and, unfortunately upon his first slice discovered they had turned it into beef jerky. The waitress apologized and brought it back. She then returned to inform us that they had no more New Yorks. We expected the worse, especially since my husband really had his heart set on a steak. To our pleasant surprise, the waitress said the head chef was very sorry and that we could order anything as a replacement, suggesting their most expensive steak, a ribeye. Given the opportunity, my husband opted for the Tomahawk ribeye. A 36oz behemoth with an equally sized price.   I don't have all the words to describe the Tomahawk. It was amazing, melt-in-your-mouth, savory steak. That is what steaks should taste like. It's hard to fathom the $145 tag, but if you have the desire or a special occasion, do it. Do it. It's huge. It's fantastic. It's memorable.  The staff was good, the food was excellent, the atmosphere was great and they have an extensive beer and wine list, plus fun specialty cocktails. We will definitely return!

We are a group of 12, and agreed that it was the best meal any of us had enjoyed in a long time. The steaks were tender and flavorful and scallops perfectly tender. Do yourself a favor and order the mashed potatoes, cauliflower and mushrooms as sides. The duck fat fries have a zing to them. Amazing!!!!!

Dropped by before a concert. BUSY LOUD  and FUN. DUCK fat fries are a must,  also had HAMACHI. BUT the highlight of the the meal were the 3 small biscuits in a small iron skillet. I am from the south and know biscuits but these were the best I have ever eaten-sorry GRANDMA. Light flaky and dusted with sugar we saved them for dessert!

Came here on Sunday with a group of girls for a bachelorette weekend of fun. This was our last night in Vegas and wanted to have an awesome dinner.   I mostly rated this place based on service..I mean maybe it would have been 3 stars if the food was better.  I was super hungover on Sunday so I only got myself a salad. I did try some of the other girl's food and it wasn't anything too special.  I really wish I remembered what our waiters name was, because for the response be gave me and the type of restaurant this place is, I would have expected kinder service.  One of the girls at the end of dinner asked our waiter for a togo box. As she asked him, I also asked him if I could get a box too. His response was, he pointed his finger in the air and told me to "hold on, I can only do ONE thing at a time" he said "my assistant will box it up" then he looked away and ROLLED HIS EYES AT ME and mummered "okay" to himself with crazy eyes and walked away.  I thought I was totally tripping when he did that to me, but 2 other girls saw what he did so I knew I wasn't tripping, nor did I say anything or give him attitude.  Then, we asked for dessert menu and he handed everyone their Happy Hour menu and walked away really fast. We had to ask "his assistant" for the right menu since he wasn't around.  I really don't know what was up his butt, maybe drugs or something but I've never been talked to that way nor had their eyes roll at me at a restaurant when requesting a box.

In town for combined business and pleasure, I went solo to Searsucker for my last dinner before heading home.  I ordered a glass of Malbec and the flat iron steak and potatoes.  All I can say is -- wow! The marinated beef was so flavorful and absolutely delicious. The potatoes were seasoned with garlic, parmesan cheese, onions and jalape√±os -- sounds odd but it totally works. This was by far the best meal I've had in the few days I've been here, and I've done a good job of sampling some of the nicer restaurants. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

19/100 yep challenge  * Price: expensive; $200 dinner for two ( 1 share appetizer, 2 main dishes, 1 share desert, 2 drinks), 10%  higher than nearby gourmet restaurants. their food is delicious and large portion though. 3 star. * Ambience; casual , chic decor, not over the top. 4 star. * Location: Ceasar Palace but off the main food court area and the forum. We had to stop and asked for direction from 3 different restaurant hosts!  3 star. * Meals: delicious! Every bite is tasty and perfect! 5 star. * service: excellent! Everyone is very friendly and helpful! 5 star.  This is averaged to 4 star for me!  Came in on a Wednesday night and the place was half empty. We were a bit nervous but glad that we came.  The meal is perfect! Poke: fresh and perfectly seasoning served with taro chip. $19  Scottish salmon: perfectly glazed and tender! Chimichuri sauce is sweet and tangy taste which went well with the salmon. $36  Fish and chip:moist and tender with thin but crispy shell. $42.  Snore bar: graham, chocolate ganage, chocolate mouse packed in a bar served with chocolate ice cream. Not too sweet. The bar is perfect mixed between sweet, salty, chocolate softness and crunchy. $11.  We always are big fan for chef Brian Malarkey on Top chef and are not disappointed! The only reason that this place is not packed because of the price! Since there are so many restaurants by celebrity chefs nearby with 10-20% less, many people would chose others!

Only had a hour before Elton show and needed food. Got great appetizers, especially the scampi, in a timely manner. Even had time for dessert, lemon cheesecake so yummy. Our waiter Steven was attentive and nice so I will be back. The reason for only 4 stars is the hummus was bland, but there is so many other things I want to try. Managers were even friendly and stopped by for a chat.

If you're looking to get into Omnia to see a DJ/Entertainer, Seasucker does a deal where you get expedited entry into the club. Only catch is that you'll need to spend a minimum of $55/person, but on the plus side you get three bottles of wine. However, that was the deal my part of 9 got.   Ordered the filet mignon which was double seared and on a bed of saut√©ed kale. It was delicious in my book, the chef did well on making it medium rare for me.   I don't recommend ordering the roasted cauliflower. My friend ordered some to meet our $55 quota, however we barely ate it. The seasonings were off and tasted sour, which could have been the pickled chilis.   If you come here to get a special deal to get into the club, just order a main dish and a couple drinks.

There are a lot of restaurants in Caesar's Palace and I ate at three of them. This was  the most expensive of the three. It was so expensive I ordered the hamburger. While the hamburger was good and also a good size, it was $25.   The bar served their mixed drinks in very warm glasses filled with large cubes so they put only a small amount of alcohol in them and just let them get watered down by the heat of the glass. That was disappointing. Ordered a bottle of wine and they brought out a different year stating they did not have the year represented on the menu. Not a big deal unless you were only willing to pay that high of a price and ordered a specific bottle and vintage off the menu because you knew it was a good year for that wine and also knew the bookend years were not as good...as was the case here. We did get an apology from the manager stating they'd intended to update the menu but hadn't yet done so. We sent the wine back before they'd opened it.   The staff was friendly and my dinner guests seemed to enjoy themselves. They were kind enough not order the $145 cowboy steak - for obvious reasons.

My office had our holiday dinner here on a Friday night. I loved the look of the place. We shared appetizers - the brie and the duck fat fries (sounds awful) were great. I had their house salad and a catch of the day served with drunk cherries and almonds and we shared some great sides and then some desserts. All the food was fantastic. I think my favorite thing was my drink though - the Honeybadger whiskey cocktail - yum! The service was really great as well. Our main server took great care of us and lots of runners helped throughout the night.  The restaurant was quiet and relaxed when we got there at about 7 and we had a good view of the bar, which slowly started to fill up and a DJ came in. By the time we left at almost 10, the consensus was that somehow it got colder and louder. Looked like a fun place to hang out on a Friday night, but it was a good time for our relaxed dinner party to leave.
The food reminded me of Applebee's and Fridays, not bad just not what I was expecting.

I can't say much about the food because we didn't get to have any. Despite making a reservation for 11:30 a.m. brunch on Sunday, and the restaurant itself listing their opening time as 11:00 a.m., Searsucker was not open when we got there. I called the main line and no one answered, then I called again later, and they left me on hold for an unacceptable period of time. Unfortunately for them, they lost my business that day, and my future patronage as well.

We had a reservation for 8 and got seated quickly on a Saturday night.  My girlfriend and I split the beer braised short ribs (came highly recommended by the waitress) and the entree scallops.  The ribs were tender but the sauce was too salty for my taste.  The scallops were delicious and were plated on a bed of corn.  The food was decent and I would come back again to try other things on the menu.  edit: If you plan on going to the Omnia nightclub after dinner, ask the hostess at the restaurant and they can give you an express token that lets you cut through the Omnia line quicker.

My wife and I had no trouble making a reservation here the day before. When we showed up, the hostesses were polite, but not as welcoming as I would have expected. We were seated promptly.  The menu was very inviting and our server (who did not share her name with us) was very pleasant. She was very good throughout the meal - attentive, but not obtrusive, talkative, but not overly chatty. If I were offering a rating based solely on her service, it would have received a six.  We ordered drinks to start. I got the fizzy lifter and my wife got the blackberry smash. Both were very, very good with plenty of alcohol. In fact, we later ordered a couple more. The server readily provided us with a detailed description of how to make the fizzy lifter when we requested.  Our first appetizer was an order of shisheido peppers. Cooked perfectly, but a little salty. The ponzu sauce was a fantastic addition (its flavor made the small chunks of salt sprinkled on top unnecessary, in my opinion).  Our second appetizer was the short rib. Succulent and cooked perfectly, it was served on a bed of mashed potatoes with a wonderful gravy. This was the best part of our meal.  We split the hanger steak for a main course (we planned in advance for dessert). It was delicious! It was served on small potatoes and mushrooms with an appropriately sized drizzle of a chimichurri sauce that was (1) very good (me), or (2) ok (my wife). Overall, a fine selection to split.  We ordered the ice cream sandwich and the ice cream selection for dessert. While the ice creams were delicious (chocolate, salted caramel and cappuccino), the ice cream sandwich was the star. This is a must if you are a dessert person. Served on caramel and accompanied by a large dollop of fresh whipped cream, I was left attempting to lick the plate.  The decor was tasteful, but it was a little loud, being next to the casino. Overall, a very good place to pop in for a dinner.  We did not experience many of the negative things mentioned by other reviewers. If you go the Searsucker, I hope your experience equals ours.

Adventurous comfort food.  Is that an oxymoron?  Well, go to Searsucker and decide for yourself.  My advice, though, would be to take a good look at the menu first.  You will either spot some unusual dishes that you are dying to try, or (like me) you will decide this just doesn't look like my cup of tea.  I went here only because I was with a group that was staying at Caesar's and chose this restaurant.  I was looking for something less adventurous than the crispy pig's ears and such.  I might have ordered a burger, but the menu trumpets that they only make 20 of them per night.  How pretentious!  You might get one, or not.  I prefer to do my gambling in the casino, so I ordered tomato soup, a Cobb salad, and also split a mac & cheese and an order of cornbread with my wife.  The soup was okay; nothing special.  The Cobb salad wasn't.  I mean it wasn't a Cobb salad.  Greens and bacon mostly, with a vinaigrette dressing - closer to a Spinach salad.  The mac & cheese was very rich and quite good; I guess it's hard to mess up that dish unless you load it up with truffles, which (thank God) they didn't.  The cornbread really should have been the complementary bread plate, but if they insist on charging five bucks for it - well, that's how it goes.  My wife did like her brick chicken.  Seersucker tries to brand itself as a comfortable party place.  I didn't see it that way.  It had a weird ambiance, with giant fish skeletons and pictures of roosters on the walls.  The bar area was not comfortable, and the bar service was slow.  I'm not going to comment on the dining room service because, as I said, we were with a group and it is entirely possible that someone in the group was slowing things down with a lot of questions and dithering.  However, the place did seem to be understaffed.  Well, at least the prices were reasonable (by Caesar's Palace standards).
Always enjoyed everything I've had there, cocktails, lunch & happy hour. Good presentation and atmosphere. Good service and wine list.

Looks good great atmosphere & great service. However our food was enough to where we were not hungry which is normally perfect for me. I don't like waste and oversized portions. I had the steak cauliflower it was decent flavor and I kept my calorie count in check but seriously there was nothing but mashed up gooey looking tomatoes served with it. No sides whatsoever to compliment the dish. The spice chicken my husband had was flavorful but he ate every morsel and also had nothing but tomatoes on the side which he does not like and didn't know they were part of the dish. So basically we are saying we felt like suckers for choosing Searsucker :( wine list and prices not fair definitely overpriced and I'm not referring to overpriced as expected.
Ah.maz.ing! delicious food, perfect ambiance, a lot of unique and boutique items to choose from. Perfect service and managed by pros. Chef is outstanding! Must try!!

I love all the Searsucker locations. The San Diego locale is my favorite, but this incarnation at Ceasar's Palace is very good as well. The service is good, the drinks inspired, the menu totally solid, and the desserts make me not want to share.   The Tuna Poke & Shaved Taro Root was a great start. The Kale & Romaine Caesar salad is a good next step towards one of Malarkey's wonderful steak dishes. I thoroughly enjoyed the filet with smoked fingerling potatoes and a Honeybadger (and a Matador.) To finish, we tried the Chocolate Trifecta, and I think it's my new favorite.  I love this place and will definitely be back!

Searsucker was a good restaurant.  Of the offerings at Caesar's, it is my favorite.  I had an amazing steak dish and my girlfriend's tuna was equally amazing.  I liked the decor of the restaurant as well.

Service is kind of slow but extremely attentive.  Food was spectacular. We had a table of nine and everything I tried was awesome. I recommend getting the ceviche with some toast (to dip into the sauce).The pickles are also very good if you like spicy things.  I think next time I would try the mushroom buratta toast or the beet salad.  My only complaint was that the lettuce in the Caesar salad was too large. Smaller cuts would have been easier to eat.

Very happy with this spot. Came to Vegas during March Madness. So a spot to eat REALLY good food, have good drinks, and good service, and have good seats to watch the games....?! Works for me.   We came here for breakfast/brunch every day during our stay. At times felt like the service was a little slow. But the food was well worth the wait. The service was also incredibly friendly, personable, and knowledgeable of their menu. We did not have one bad meal their.  The pricing is not cheap. Not super expensive either. But hey, everything is over priced in Vegas. At least the food is so good, the value for the money spent redeems itself.   The booths fill up quickly, so I recommend getting a reservation if you have a group of more than 2-3 people. Otherwise, there is a pretty good shot you can walk right in and get a spot at a bar top table or at the bar.   Definitely a go to while staying at Cesar's /)

Great food, drinks, service, the works. I came to Searsucker to watch game 3 of the World Series and have dinner with co-workers. The pork ears especially stood out, as well as the cocktails. Ask about the Omnia package-- spend $50 and you get a chip that allows you to cut the line. Totally worth it.

I would go back here in a SECOND!! The food was LEGIT! So GOOD!!   Definitely make reservations, it was busy! We were seated at a lovely "people watching" window seat. It was great. We were going to see a show, so we kept it pretty simple.  Ordered a caesar salad to split, and our entrees.  The two entrees we had were Beef Ribs with horseradish mash. YUM!!! And very filling!! The other was a piece of grilled swordfish which included a choice of sauce and side. Both were fantastic.  The "share plates" looked so interesting, I want to go back just to site and nibble on little social plates! So many interesting things on there that looked good to try!  As for service, I have noticed many criticisms for bad service, I am happy to say that absolutely was not our experience!! The woman who was helping us was attentive and an asset to the dining experience.

Ill suited to my vegatarian preferences, most menu items were a big slab of meat. Even the mussles had chorizo.  Strange location too.  Wouldn't take reservations on Open Table, but then the restaurant was 3/4 empty when we stopped by without a res.  There were two elements I will compliment: nice wine list, and delicious dessert served in large portions.
Great drinks... can't beat happy hour. Had the sliders.... fantastic. Service was good. Nice location. Would def come back.

Great food and great service. The Assistant General Manager, Nick came by and checked on us. He was extremely friendly and answered any questions we had. Thank you for giving us the story on why the restaurant is called Searsucker!   Try the snickerdoodle ice cream sandwich!! It's AMAZING! Will be back again soon!

I had wanted to go to Searsucker since it opened, so I decided to go for my birthday with our house-guests in town from Washington.   Needless to say, expectations were high. I am happy to say Searsucker delivered!  I had the Mahi Mahi and it was so good. Others at the table had the duck, the loin filet, and the scallops. Everyone at the table enjoyed their meal.  The sides are family-style which was great for trying a few options.  My favorite was the jalape√±o-chorizo corn-off-the-cobb, but we all also the fried brussels, and the cauliflower were tasty.   Now, on to the drinks. The cocktails were amazing!!  Between the four of us, we had several different options.  My fave was the Peter Rabbit.   The atmosphere and service were also wonderful!

This was my first visit to Searsucker in Vegas.  They have a good happy hour during the weekend.  The dish are small, but what else would you expect.  They had about 5 or so cocktail options.  We tried almost each one.  Pretty good!
So close to five stars! The succulent short ribs are too die for as are the vinegar Brussels sprouts and walnuts... But both were served barely warm.  Friendly service.$$$+

Searsucker has given me a new reason to visit the strip. As a native, I tend to avoid the area. This restaurant makes you feel right at home, and takes you away from Vegas just for a moment. From the hospitality, to infused liquors, Searsucker has won me over in every single way. My first trip here was a Yelp event, where of course we were spoiled. However, when I returned for a ladies night with Jessie B., we were still spoiled! The chef sent out a complimentary dish when we first arrived which really set the tone. The service was stellar beginning to end. And the food, let's talk about the FOOD!  The salads are so fresh, I literally could eat every single one of them. The crab cake is the best crab cake I ever have tasted. That particular night Jessie and I shared the special, a fettuccine made in house topped with fresh pesto, shrimp, and mussels. WOW. My mouth waters as I type. I could see the chef from where I was sitting and he seemed so passionate when plating our dishes. You could tell they really care about what comes out of their kitchen.  After our meal we went to the bar to try one of these amazing cocktails. I went with the Bad Bad TRoy Brown, and I only needed one! It was strong, but perfectly made. The bartender warned me that it was not a weak drink.  The manager even came by the bar and spoke to us, mentioning happy hour. Speaking of happy hour, I need to plan a trip back here, and soon!

I've had the chance to eat here twice! Once was for an event, so we had appetizers being passed... and everything was great.  Came back with friends for a proper dinner.  The three of us decided to order a variety of the "small plates", including the cowboy caviar, the bone marrow, snakebite lollipops, quail and mussels.  We were under the impression that "small plates" would be small... but, we WAY over ordered.  The small plates were large, in our opinion.  I could have had the qual by myself as a filling meal.   But, hey, that makes this place a fantastic value!!    Food was fresh, creative, and everything was absolutely delicious.  My hubby raves about the bone marrow!  Will be back!

What do I say about this gem - great food, great service, fun atmosphere.  I've said it all before, but Searsucker checks all the boxes AND captures that extra special something.  The people here are terrific and make you feel special.  The room is energetic and fun, and the music is always on point.  Then you start eating; beef tartare, eggs & bacon, short rib, crab cake, mahi and cherries, pork butt!  Or splurge and get the tomahawk!  And you should drink a Honey Badger or a Matador because why not?!  Don't skip the chocolate chip cookies - I'm not kidding.  They are life changing.
The fish and chips are the best thing...with amazing presentation. If you leave without trying the Rocky Road Bread Pudding, you are a fool. It is sheer delight.

My husband and I are from San Diego and visit the Valley Ho Hotel regularly in the Old Town district close to Fashion Square. Being familiar with the Searsucker Brand and Brian Malarkay, we were excited to check out the latest addition. It is fabulous!! The decor, vibe music, food and drinks. Well worth checking out.We both enjoyed how cozy it feels. We met the Managment Staff Owen and Les and had a nice chat with them. Both very professional and courteous. We were even more impressed with our server Amy. She is a 10!  Hard to find that level of service anymore. Can't wait to come back on our next trip!!

Awesome awesome food. Had the bad bad t-roy brown to start and the peter rabbit which were both amazing. Moved to a table and our server was extremely knowledgable. ( Sorry I forgot his name) The green peppercorn reduction was damn good on the Aged Strip and those butter potatoes were on point. Thanks for being our last meal in Vegas before coming home to NY!

Went last week during happy hour. Had the bone marrow and it was wonderful. I think we ordee about 3-4 of them. Tried the oysters and sliders and didn't really care for it.  Definitely coming back for the bone marrow!

Hip and fashionable, Searsucker was a delight. The music sounded like one of my playlists, making it even more delightful. The food, fairly eclectic.  Searsucker's menu definitely marches to the beat of a different drummer with it's crab mac 'n cheese, lobster dumplings, and shrimp in bacon grits.  Other notables were the cauliflower in creme fraiche, and the short rib entree.  On the cocktail side, the Honeybadger brought a tear to my eye. The same drink concoction my late mother used to give us kids when we were sick....bourbon, honey and fresh squeezed lemonade, this drink was not only delicious, but brought back a flood of precious mom memories.  Searsucker isn't for the vanilla lover, it's geared more toward the peanut brittle, fudge chocolate cherry lime ice-cream lover.

Been twice now and think it may be one of our favorite restaurants. Service has been excellent both times and the food was delicious. Exceptional wine list and large appetizers can make a meal. Price is just right for the creations. I have never been disappointed by size for money. Highly recommended the Vegas location..........as for the Austin location, we'll let's just say I'm a car ride away and haven't been yet.............

Hosted a group event here on a Monday night. We had the bar/lounge area to ourselves which was great. The waiters came around and took drink orders, they were very fast and efficient. Our group of 30 was sat a two large tables in a partially private area. We started with the lollipop wings, ahi tuna tacos and calamari steak. WOW. The lollipop wings were amazing, the heat on them was seriously perfect. I loved the way they were trimmed too, the least messy wings I have ever encountered. For my entr√©e I got the steak that came with a roasted pepper. There were brussels sprouts for sharing as well. The steak was seasoned perfect, I ordered mine medium and it was a tad under, I didn't eat the center because it was a bit too purple for me, but that's personal preference. For dessert we had the assorted cakes and chocolate chip cookies, these were probably the best chocolate chip cookies I have ever had. I'm not a huge sweets person but I ate 3. THREE.   The service during dinner was great as well.   Prior to planning the dinner the event staff was awesome! They were always quick to respond to any questions I had, adjusted our time when I arrived late for the event and were accommodating when a guest didn't want anything from the preset menu. Thank you so much for a great evening!!

I ordered the drunken steak, description said it was a beer grilled steak with crispy potatoes.  They did bring me a steak and crispy potatoes but the steak was a thin, pre-sliced steak with chimichurry sauce and an entire ocean worth of salt. It was disgusting. The crispy potatoes weren't any better, they were drenched in salt and had grilled jalapenos and onions mixed in with parmesean cheese. I don't think the fries would have been too bad if they didn't have so. much. salt.  I was so convinced that they didn't bring me the right dish that I even asked the waiter, who confirmed that it was indeed the drunken steak. I'm still not convinced he didn't mishear me.  The service was mediocre. It took about 10 minutes to get my check after I asked for it.

This place is TOP NOTCH! I love trying new things and if you are down to try something different this is the place to go. Everything is awesome including the drinks. Peter rabbit is a great drink and different. Love it!

A few nights ago my fianc√© and I wanted to have a quiet dinner so we decided on searsucker. Once the waitress approached she seem very genuine and pleasantly nice. She seemed to know the menu like the back of her hand. She mentioned a grilled salmon as the special that night and I went for it. She explained the entree with such details I couldn't say no. Once the salmon got to the table it was noticeably raw. If we wanted sushi we could have gone to a sushi restaurant. I asked the waitress if maybe I could get a salmon that was cooked through as this raw fish wasn't to my liking. She said "oh yea I forgot to tell you it comes pink" what?! Lol anyways once the second plate came to the table is was the exact same one that they took but only this time they they threw it back on the pan to warm it up and brought it back. By the way this is a "health code violation!" I was supposed to get a brand new salmon! Did you run out of salmon ? You had to bring me the same cut up salmon and drizzle a little sauce on the side! I was so embarrassed for them! Never again! Thanks for charging me full price $165!  Very classy.
Hostess was rude and very unhelpful. Server was non personable and slow. Food was just ok. Had the pork butt and it was not the best. The bussers were the nicest and most friendly.

After spending many hours researching the best place to eat Thanksgiving dinner in Vegas, we wound up here completely by chance and had hands down the best turkey meal of our lives (sorry grandma, but it's true).   Once we got to town we noticed that EVERYONE was doing a holiday dinner. Prix fixed menus were constantly in our faces, and we felt overwhelmed by all the different choices. Should we keep it casual, find a swanky place and dress up, hit a buffet, hide and order room service? The last one was starting to sound very appealing.   We were sitting across the way at the Alto bar watching the Cowboys game, when I spotted their sign advertising $50 a person for an all you can eat dinner. Wanting to be done with the search I asked around our table if that would do, and we all agreed to pull the trigger and make the reservation so we could relax and get back to the game.   We came back that evening expecting to find a buffet setup with long lines, but instead were treated to a practically empty restaurant and sat in an intimate candle lit booth. Our waitress brought out waters and not even 10 minutes later we all had the piping hot thanksgiving special plates sitting in front of us.   We were given the choice between white, dark, or both cuts of turkey. Each plate also came with mashed potatoes, green beans with crispy onion strings, fresh cranberry sauce, and sausage stuffing. Because we were feeling gluttonous, we also started with the $5 plate of biscuits with whipped butter and honey. HEAVEN!  The turkey was incredibly tender (I refuse to use the M word but it was), the mashed potatoes creamy and rich with the addition of the sour cream sauce on top, the green beans fresh, and crispy onions on top deliciously salty...just man. It was delicious.   None of us really cared for the cranberry sauce, but that's usually an afterthought anyhow. I'm just as happy with the canned stuff if I'm honest and theirs was a little too citrusy for me. And while I enjoyed the sausage stuffing, I found myself missing the meatless version so that it wasn't in competition with the turkey.  Truly dynamite meal though. We all got seconds (some even thirds, don't judge) and left blissfully dreaming about getting back to the room and changing into stretchy pants.  It was hard to determine what their normal cuisine is as we saw deer antlers, fish bones, and ropes decorating the room but honestly? I don't care. I would come back anytime and would be happy with any plate they set in front of me. It was absolutely delectable and worth every freaking penny.

Second time visiting Searsucker and this place has gone downhill, bigtime. We arrived with no reservation to grab a quick bite and were told the wait was over an hour for a table. Seeing there were plenty of vacant tables we hopped on opentable and made a reservation for 15 minutes later. The hostess wasn't thrilled about this, but I'm not sure why she didn't just accommodate us when we arrived.   Since we had 15 minutes to kill we figured we'd sit at the bar to pass the time. After being ignored for at least 5 minutes a bartender approached us. He took our order and we then were approached by three different bartenders asking if we had been helped yet. Again, weird. Needless to say, we ditched the table and just decided to eat at the bar.   Appetizers arrived in less than 5 minutes. Awesome, but it definitely makes you feel like nothing is prepared to order. Either way, our salad and tuna poke tasted great.   Then we waited for the entrees.   And waited.   And waited.   We asked three times and each time the response was "oh it's coming right up"  After 35 minutes we had to leave for an event so we asked to close our check and were charged for our entrees that we never recieved. Weird.   We let the bartender know we never received the entrees so we didn't want to pay for them. He said "oh, sorry" went and adjusted our bill and dropped it off without saying anything. After he ran our card he dropped it off and said "Thanks guys!"  Honestly, not something I would expect from a restaurant like Searsucker. The entire experience was irritating enough that there's no real reason to return. When I go somewhere to eat, I generally hope to at least be served my food.

Love the tomahawk!  My favorite steak of all Las Vegas restaurants.  The steak tar tar is a great starter and I always get the cauliflower as a side.  The short rib is also to die for but I would take the Tomahawk over anything else.  We sat at the bar this time and our awesome waitress Heather was very attentive and made sure we were happy.

Service was horrible. Main courses were horrible. Do not waste your money, appetite or time. The only thing that will keep this place open is the appetizers. If you have to come here, sit in the bar and order wine and appetizers. Their "specialty cocktails" contained 0 alcohol.

If you want a smooth but settling drink I would recommend the skinny Jenny, very light on the stomach to cleanse the taste buds. We started off with the pickles and jalape√±os, not too salty but a slight kick at the end balanced out the saltiness of a pickle. The calamari was amazing, the first bite had spicy tastwhich complimented the gamy taste of calamari.The chorizo corn has a citrusy first bite and the aftertaste puts in a slight kick that makes you feel like you are eating more than just corn. The short rib with the combo of the mashed potatoes and gravy melts in your mouth, the tenderness of the short ribs is off the chain.  I would highly recommend this restaurant if you want to satisfy your pallet.

Stumbled upon it in Caesar's Palace and was pleasantly surprised. Hostess initially wouldn't let us in w/ outside drinks but when she saw my struggle to "chug" a full vodka tonic she eased up & told me to say it was H20. Appreciate that!  Our waiter was kinda a jerk (Steven) and seemed not to have patience with the 2 of us. He didn't explain the menu when we had questions, completely forgot a drink order and then left us once our food arrived. Asked for a steak knife for our cauliflower steak (delicious) but never got one and had to use a butter knife to cut.  The busser tended to us with refills and was nice- Steve appeared with the bill and that was all.   Food was delicious and highly recommend the pig ears. Not crunchy but not soggy and the cilantro w like was IDEAL for a shared pre dinner nosh.   Cauliflower steak was perfect; not too heavy and the sauces were paired perfectly.   Duck fat fries were good but alittle on the salty side.

Habanero + coriander pickle ($4): the spicyness doesn't kick in until you eat it...I would not recommend if u cannot handle spicy food.  Mahi "Baja" ($33) - fish with drunken cherries and smokey almonds.  I wasn't a fan of the drunken cherries, but the smokey almonds with the fish was good.  Perfect if you will be going to the club next door after dinner. :)

I've been here a few times, and I'm consistently happy with every bite! Never mind that this is the best place to be for seeing reasons why Scottsdale landed on one of the Top Ten Worst Dressed (hey, tiny dresses without spanx and blinged jeans with tattooed shirts clearly appeal to middle class masses), so the people watching is wonderful.... But the highlight is definitely the food! I'm a snob when it comes to shrimp & grits, and I was ready to write an Ode to the Chef with my first bite. The mussels taste good, but are hit or miss - tonight I had some grit, and that is a preparation issue (and not in the happy bacon grits way). The cocktails are as delicious as they are playful, and I can't seem to get enough of the crisp, clean flavor of the Peter Rabbit. I sort of want to go read about how Flopsy and Mopsy are doing... But maybe I'll just have another cocktail and tackle the giant scallop with bacon caramel sauce! You know, come to think of it, I haven't had an entree yet because I eat to my palate's delight from the awesome small plate selection!

What a snazzy addition to a tired business building in Scottsdale! Before the arrival of Searsucker, I drove by this building on a daily basis and never gave it second thought. However, now everyday I drive by, it makes me want to stop into Searsucker because I am meow a fan!!   First, I love the atmosphere. They completely opened up the ceiling with sky scrapers placed throughout the restaurant. In addition to the sky scrapers, trees grace floorboards which make it feel like an indoor garden. The furniture's modern and earthy which matches the fresh vibe. You can see the chefs making the food in the kitchen and an open bar area holds comfortable couches as well as high tops. It's very fresh and airy for being inside a corporate building!   Now let's move on to the food, oh my the food! I can only review the lunch menu since I've only been for lunch, but if the dinner menu's anything like lunch, then I'm a fan. My two menu highlights are the Havarti turkey sandwich and the delectable chocolate caramel peanut bacon sundae! That might not be the correct name, but that's how I like to describe it! The Havarti Turkey sandwich has freshly roasted turkey with a cranberry jam, sprouts and fresh cracked wheat bread. It's accompanied by a salad and a perfectly fresh lunch.   I enjoy a leisurely lunch at Searsucker and especially enjoy their delicious craft cocktails at night!   **** Checklist: visit for weekend brunch soon!

What can I say about Searsucker?  I was blown away.  Literally.  Never have I wished I could give a sixth star on a review before.  We went to Searsucker on a Saturday night before a Penn and Teller show.  We started off with the Frites - usually just fries.  But these were other-worldly.  Seasoned perfectly, and fried to perfection.  I went to heaven.  Thinking we were in some carb induced haze, we ordered the sliders after that.  A small bite of perfection.  Thinking we needed some veggies, my dining partner ordered the brussel sprouts and I ordered the heirloom carrots.  We were both blown away again and I can say it's the only time I have ever tasted brussel sprouts and thought they were good.  Like really good.  Back on the protein trail, we ordered the short ribs and this was the coup de gras.  This was easily the best "small plate" dinner we have ever had.  The service was also outstanding.  I just wish I was back in Vegas to go again and try more of their tasty food.  Do yourself a favor and get over to Searsucker as fast as you can.  You won't be disappointed.

Man, I became so tired of spending a ton of money on lackluster meals.  This was one of them.  It's like this restaurant thinks they'll never see you again, because you're a tourist and all, so the food is meh.  It's like they didn't even really try and they want to be something they're not.  Our female server was a doll, however.

We were 3 for dinner here a few nights ago. I have been a big fan of Searsucker since discovering it in San Diego a few years ago. I had mentioned at that time that the Pork Belly entree I had would be a contender as a last meal request should I ever be condemned. On this visit, my wife and I and our friend decided to share some small plates and then choose entrees. We had the Tuna Poke which was excellent and served with crunchy tortilla crackers. We also had the grilled Shishito peppers which  wonderfully seasoned with soy sauce and not too hot, though with Shishitos you never know when you'll get a real burner! We also had the spicy shrimp ceviche which was served with crispy taro root chips. All three were superb! For the mains both our friend and I had the Pork Butt (The Pork Belly I longed for was not on offer) However, the Butt was tender and perfectly cooked, and was served with some sides that I also really liked but don't recall just now. My wife had the scallops, which is always a fave of hers and these did not disappoint! They shared a slice of lemon cheesecake which they described as "pretty awesome!" All around this is a fantastic place for dinner.  The only thing I would say that misses the mark at this location is that it's slightly too bright and they had huge TV's playing Monday night football at top volume, that made it difficult to have a normal conversation. The other Searsucker location was intimate and dim and would be a great date place, this location seems to be more like a sports bar which was incongruent with the food offerings.

Great vibes, great food, and an overall great experience. From the moment I entered Searsucker, I felt a welcoming ambiance that lingered the whole night.  Started the dinner with their duck fat fries with chipotle ketchup and the short ribs. The fries were amazing and the short ribs were tender and succulent.  For mains, I ordered the loin "filet"  with lobster butter and mushroom demi. The filet was cooked to the perfect temperature. I also tried some of the salmon which was also delicious as well.  Now, my absolute favorite part of dinner was the dessert. I tried the S'mores bar and the Cookies  and Milk. Both were perfect toppers to a delicious meal. Never thought a ordinary food combination like milk and cookies could actually taste so unique.  The staff and management were very welcoming and provided me and my group with a unique and great dining experience. Managers stopped by our table to greet us, and even Chef Brian Malarkey stopped by our table to ask us how everything was.   Definitely a must-see in Las Vegas!

for the Yelp event... great location and great food and great atmosphere. although the tastings were heavy on the meat, we were able to sample a few options. the brussel sprouts at the pig table were grilled, crispy, salty, and crunchy just perfectly. the mashed potatoes at the rib table were divine...very smooth, creamy, almost pureed but not as runny. we sampled many, many items from the food art table courtesy of Chef Chop.  the cheeses, tiny mushrooms and pickles, the sauces, the caviar (i think), went oh so well together.  our drinks, the popcorn margarita and the lemonade were well made and had plenty of alcohol to give some buzz.   a great restaurant for meat eaters i'm sure. i hope they make it!

I'm usually pretty skeptical of celebrity chef restaurants but was happily proven wrong last night! Our meal was fantastic from start to finish. We were also on a time crunch bc we had a show to catch and our waiter got us in and out very quickly ! We had the tomato and burrata, the bacon Mac n cheese, the sliders, and the lobster tails with Brussels sprouts. Every single dish was fantastic, we will be back for sure ! Also ordered a FRESH lemonade and it was unreal.

If you're planning on clubbing at Omnia, Searsucker is a great choice for dinner. Casual ambiance with fancy beer food and a ton of carbs so your body can handle the dance and drink throughout the night.  I tried the following:  -Bone Marrow: Massive! Usually with bone marrow, you're fighting over it with the people you're with because you're all sharing one dinky bone. But one order here has 3 massive bones topped with a chutney and tons of crisped brussel sprout leaves.  -Mac n Cheese: I've never seen mac n cheese made with the wheel-shaped pasta that you see in kids' meals. It works though because the cheese sits in between the crevices. And if it wasn't already creamy enough, there's a huge dollop of sour cream on top.  -Sliders: Taste was fine but it was over cooked and too charred.   -Duck Fat Fries: Definitely a must get! I don't how they cook these but every millimeter of the fries are crispy. The ketchup tastes housemade too (not sure if it is).  -Biscuits: My favorite item of the night. You can taste the butter that went into the making of the dough and then top it with more butter. It just gets better and better. It's not extremely flakey but super moist. It comes out piping hot.   Portions are huge. Service was so so. Water was always filled but when we told the server about the over cooked sliders, she didn't offer to take it off the bill. She just said she wish we told her earlier so she could make us a new plate. It wasn't until we told the manager that they compensated us for it.

We always go here on a Vegas trip.  The drinks are we'll crafted.  Service is great.  Sit at the bar overlooking the kitchen if you like to people work while you are having fun.  I flipped them a hundy last time in (I was on a roll and shared the wealth.)   For something festive and different, have the bone marrow followed by a bourbon shot down the funnel.

Searsucker? That is quite a different name though don't be fooled by it. This restaurant that labels itself "The New American Classic" has quite the bit of flavor packed into it. The appetizers, entree, and desert was a delicious and full-filling meal. Let's now eat our way into "The New American Classic" Searsucker. This fabulous restaurant is located in Caesars Palace in the casino section.  The first appetizer I sunk my teeth into were the lollipop wings ($18.00) these were some of the best wings I have ever had. The lollipop style they were served as were brand new to me however.  Genius! I exclaimed they were perfect; the meat all on one end was a masterful idea for dipping. They were smothered in buffalo sauce; they were spicy but not enough to scare me away. They were served along with a blue cheese fondue that was creamy and went great with the lollipops of a carnivores dream.  Next I had something very new to me and straight from the sea. These were raw oysters ($3/each) they were served in a bucket of ice and served along with a pomegranate topping. They smelled very fresh and fishy almost as if they just netted and prepared them right then and there. From a bite they have no flavor but with the pomegranate topping gave it a sweet flavor and made them easier to go down the pallet.  Then I went on to my favorite course the entree I had beer braised short ribs ($35.00). They were served along fried and crispy onions ring all on top of mash potatoes smothered in gravy. The ribs were tender and I could cut they with just the edge of my fork. The mashed potatoes were very light and fluffy and went with the meatiness of the ribs. Onion rings I love to death however the ones I have were a bit too greasy for my taste and I wish they were a bit crispier on the fry.  Last but truly not least was the desert crafted in my dreams three ice cream sandwiches ($18.00). Two were served vanilla and one...CHOCOLATE!!!! (those who get that sponge-bob reference you are amazing) there was a side of whip cream, Nutella, and mocha cream. The cookies on the sandwiches had that great homemade taste and the ice cream tasted freshly made. The chocolate sandwich had these wonderful chocolate almost coco puffs placed around it. The Nutella had a great chocolate punch and the whip cream was great. The mocha cream however was a bit strong but great on the sandwiches.  Ah! America the home of the brave and free with some of the best food you could taste. Searsucker is only a bite of what you can have here and is a great first stop. Warm and filling the food is just like its decor a truly great foodie stop.  Let's see where my taste buds take me next!

Service is exceptional here. Les went out of his way to make us feel welcome and followed up with us the next time we were in even remembering our names. The Rum and Coke dessert is epic and you HAVE to try the Eggs and Bacon!!

We were welcomed back and they more than made up for it.    My rating as of right now. This is based on the poor customer service I just received. I booked my reservation online and confirmed it via phone. They call today to tell me it is being pushed till later, which was unacceptable due to other plans. It's my wife's birthday and this ruined our evening plans. Would have liked to try the food, maybe another time.

I'm a big Top Chef fan so when I heard Chef Brian Malarkey opened up his San Diego restaurant in Caesars I had to stop by. Not having much time, we decided to just try a few dishes at the bar. BTW, their happy hour menu is really awesome here. I've posted a pic of it.  Crab cake was awesome. I can say the best I've had. Loved all the elements that came with it including the aioli and Tabasco caviar.  Squid was nice. Not your typical fried calamari. It's a slice up a calamari steak, batter, fried and tossed in a sweet mild chili sauce. Think calamari steak fries.  Duck fat fries were nice but chipotle ketchup threw it off for me. We asked if they have regular ketchup, they don't. The fries have a crisp that you won't get frying with typical oil.  After some amazing apps, the short rib underwhelmed. It was very typical and a bit bland.  I like my drinks sweet, this is not the place for sweet drinks. We had the Indian Summer and Achilles Peel. Achilles Peel was better but we had to ask for simple syrup.  Our server Lindsey was super cool. She was friendly, knowledgeable and was on top of everything we needed.  Will be back for dinner next time!

We stumbled upon this restaurant in Vegas while walking towards Omnia Nightclub at Caesar's. The club was not open yet and we had about 1 hour to spare so why not a little grub before clubbing? I had actually bookmarked this place before our trip so by faith, we ended up here.  The dining area was nice but we just sat the bar and got a bunch of appetizers to share and a specialty cocktail for each. For grub, we had Crispy Pig's Ears w/ cilantro, lime, sea salt, the Duck Fat Fries w/ parmesan, prosciutto, herbs, and the Bone Marrow w/ fresno chili bourbon glaze. Both presentation and taste were on point. Ears were crunchy and tangy. Fries were perfectly crisp but the Bone Marrow was the clear winner. It was so tasty and slimy in very good way. Wish we ordered another one. For drinks, I tried the Snake in The Grass made w/ cucumber gin, bruised mint, lime, and soda. It was well prepped, refreshing and strong. My buddy got the Japanese Manhattan made w/ Toki Japanese whiskey, sweet vermouth, orgeat, sake, and bitters. He let me have a sip and it was also good and potent. Sharable apps start at $5 to $18 and specialty cocktails average about $14.  Sear Sucker was a great find in Vegas. Reasonably priced tasty food, well prepped strong cocktails and nice bartenders. Definitely a good spot to have dinner or pregame before a night of clubbing or gambling.
Very tasty food. Get the shrimp and grits and you won't be sorry and I know I'm from the south and that was better than my mama's! Great service too.

Searsucker is getting  solid 4 stars because our waiter and the chef went above and beyond to make our experience top notch.  Food is unconventional and tasty and we had the added bonus of having the sous chef come by our table and provide suggestions on how to eat each of the small plates which were little delicious concoctions of flavor and texture.   Favorite - the marrow with fried Brussels sprouts - suggestion by chef.

Loved this place. We had an amazing waitress and I'm sad that I can't remember her name. She brought out complimentary cheddar puffers with jalapenos. I love my cheese, so this was off to a great start! She suggested that we try the 'Eggs & Bacon' which is a slice of brioche topped with the most succulent pork belly with a poached eggs glazed in hollandaise sauce. It was a life changing experience! MUST HAVE! We also had the bone marrow which was one of the best I've ever tried followed by the beef tartare. Can't wait to go back to Vegas so I can go to this restaurant again!

We stopped here for a quick dinner while staying at Caesars and didn't really have set expectations for the food because the over the years various grab and go snack or burger joints have moved in and out of this space, but we were honestly pleasantly surprised by our experience.   The location is kind of tucked away so unless people are gambling in that area or do some research I feel like they probably aren't even aware that it is there. The interior has cool d√©cor and lighting. The atmosphere is modern and inviting. And the vibe is come as you are and come hungry.  I did love that they had a Yelp check-in offer. I just started using Yelp a few months ago so I am always very excited when I find a new place that provides an offer with check-in and theirs did not disappoint! They brought me an entire bowl of Habanero and Coriander soaked pickles and as a pickle lover I was very pleased!   We decided to order multiple dishes and share them at the table.  Below is a breakdown of what we ordered:  -Biscuits with whipped butter and infused honey *Literally do not leave here without eating these and make sure to smother them in honey. SO good.  -Tomato and burrata in a mason jar *kind of a twist on caprese salad or bruschetta - very "instagramable" presentation and delicious.  -Field greens and pear salad with champagne vinegar goat cheese and candied walnuts *loved this salad and everything in it -- definitely recommend.  -Shrimp Scampi with spaghetti squash, garlic, and lemon *my mom and sister really enjoyed this. I am not a huge spaghetti squash fan so it wasn't my favorite.  -Slider trio with bacon, cheddar, chipotle, and crispy onions.  *my mom and sister are a little bit pickier when it comes to sauces and toppings so I was willing to eat the sliders sans chipotle and onions, but the staff were so accommodating that they brought the plate of 3 customized to our liking (1 with everything and 2 without). These were awesome so I can only imagine how delicious the full size burgers are!  Overall I would strongly recommend Searsucker as a break from the steakhouses and reservation only restaurants. The food is great, the service is awesome, and the environment is casual and relaxing. Don't forget to check in when you arrive!

(Lyrics - Cutting Crew - Just Died in Your Arms Tonight) Oh I, I just ate at Searsuckers tonight It must have been something I read I just ate at Searsuckers tonight  I keep ordering for something I can't get Artichoke hearts lie all around me And I don't see an easy way to get out of this My cocktail sits on the bar side table The curtains are closed; the place is like an adult cradle Who would've thought that a boy like me could come to this?  Oh I, I just ate at Searsuckers tonight It must have been something I read I just ate at Searsuckers tonight  Oh I, I just ate at Searsuckers tonight It must've been some kind of dish I should've walked away, I should've walked away  Searsucker is a hot new restaurant in S. Scottsdale.  I went to the original one in San Diego and thought it was okay.  The one in Scottsdale?  Well Okay at best again.    I think this place was over-hyped.  Granted they won a lot of awards, voted best new restaurant, etc.  I brought some friends from out of town here thinking I would treat them to a good meal and experience.  Needless to say, they weren't all about it either.  We ordered a bunch of small bites since we had a long night ahead of us eating and drinking; Kobe Carpaccio, Scallop Bacon, Egg Bacon Pork Belly, Meatballs, Squid sweet heat.  The Carpaccio was good, but nothing special.  Scallops with bacon....well everything tastes good with bacon right.  My favorite was the egg bacon and pork belly -- yummy, but belongs at breakfast.  The squid was sweet and spicy and that's about it.    The place itself is pretty swanky.  The ambience is hip and romantic.  Overall, I think it's a great place to hang with friends or bring a date.
