However, gonna have to pass on the food part.  Maybe it was an off night.  Every dog has its day.  I really want to give this place a chance so me coming back is definitely.  Hopefully, this won't discourage you to go cause I would say try it on your own and let me know - wink! - Enjoy!

Pretty solid dinner spot. Drinks were strong, food was really good. The appetizers were tapas style which was a great way for our group to share some bites of everything we got. Main courses were great, I really enjoyed my side order of bacon brussel sprouts (something I never thought I would actually say regarding brussel sprouts).  Service was great, our waitress was really nice and polite. Menu is a bit pricey, but that is to be expected just about everywhere on the strip.  Overall, I'd come back for the food and service.

Visited Searsucker for dinner our last night in Vegas. Service was incredible and the food was savory! The atmosphere inside is super chic and relaxing. Great for small groups. We shared the NY Sirloin with a side of spinach. The steak was cooked perfectly and paired perfectly with the spinach.

Went with a big group of coworkers for dinner. My half of the table shared about the entire small plates menu. Everything was great! My favorites were the veggie sides, Brussels sprouts were amazing! The snake in the grass drink was great. Funky but relaxing atmosphere, I felt like I was eating in an anthropologie store. Good service. Weird location in an office building. I'd definitely go back.

Searsuck surely didn't suck for me.   Appetizer - Hummus and Grilled Flatbread: Three freshly baked, glistening flat breads that came with a small jar filled with house-made hummus. A perfect, light appetizer.   Entree - Jumbo Mexican Shrimp with Pear Ginger Chutney and a side of Roasted Mushroom & Herbs: When you order "From the Grill," you select either a meat or seafood, then choose a sauce and side dish. The jumbo shrimp is legit, folks. Searsucker doesn't skimp on size and quantity.The shrimp pairs well with the chutney; although, I wish more was provided. As for the mushrooms, they were decent.   Dessert - Chocolate Trifecta: From the smoothness of the pudding, to the crunchy chocolate "paper," I enjoyed most of the flavors and textures of this dessert. However, the cake was bland, but it might have been created intentionally to balance all the flavors. The other desserts on the menu might've done a better job in satisfying my sweet tooth.   FYI: The restaurant charges approximately 2 bucks per beverage refill -- I didn't think my Diet Pepsi was worth the extra cost; maybe another beverage would've. *shrugs*  Service: No complaints; great service.   Overall: Many of the menu offerings may not sound new and exciting, but Searsucker adds its own twist. To me, the food was fine, but I wouldn't order the same items.

Caesar our server was phenomenal! We had such a blast laughing with him and he kept the drinks full for sure! Dinner was on point, short rib was fantastic. Salmon was very very good. Hamachi in a jar and the tacos were delicious! The manager came by to check on us but it didn't seem like he was listening. Maybe Caesar should run this place!

I've been here a few times and really like this place.  The decor is super cool and the music is great.  The mussels appetizer was very good and the tongue in cheek main dish is excellent as well.  I had quite a few of their Indian Summer cocktails last weekend and they   were very refreshing.

It's barely been open for 6 months and is super easy to find! (right next to Omnia and the sportsbook)  but 5 Stars for HAPPY HOUR! It runs from 4:30pm-6:00pm Monday-Friday.  If you want to sample many of their dishes without paying the premium prices! I suggest stopping by for happy hour. Be wary, it's only in the bar area so if the hosts walks you over to the dining area, just let her know you're there for happy hour and drinks.  The menu has about a dozen items and it's significantly discounted! Food comes out "shared" style but to be honest, the portions are fairly large compared to other "small plate" or tapas style places.  We had the:  Farm Bird Lollipops - Chicken meatballs that are seared on a stick. You get three per order and they serve it over an arugala and bleu cheese salad!  Caesar Salad - MAN as a "side salad" this thing was HUGE. Only $6 well worth it.  Spicy Squid - Lightly battered squid in a hot and sour sauce. Pretty tasty, but I wish it was more crispy.   Short Rib - Super moist braised short rib over mashed potatoes. If you're buzzing and need something warm to sober you up, this dish will do the trick. $10 but portion size is fairly decent.  The cocktails and drinks are also discounted too. Most of them are under $7-$8 (marked down from $12-$16).   Service was great. Well worth it! We had all those dishes mentioned and 2 drinks each..came out to about $70. Definitely stop by if you're looking for a good experience!

Best Oysters Ever!  We couldn't get enough.  We were headed to the Oyster Bar when we found this little gym.  We went three times in our three day stay!  The bartenders were great.  Heather and Michael big shout out!  Definitely coming back

Great atmosphere, wonderful bites of food. It's pricey but it's Vegas! The duck fat fries with the homemade ketchup were out of this world. Fries were so good they really didn't even need the ketchup! We also loved the swordfish dish and the braised pork butt was so beautifully tender. I recommend starting with the calamari "steak" appetizer. AMAZING

I was so happy to see searsucker in Vegas. It's my favorite restaurant in San Diego so I dragged the hubby to this location. The bone marrow, mussels, and duck fat fries were excellent. See my photos. I love the crab cakes in the SD location but theirs are really salty. I had a hard time eating it.

Upscale casual dining in Cesar's Palace done right. The food is creative and tasteful. A successful play on most american dishes.   Chef Malarkey who gained instant pop status from ABC's "The Taste" and various Food Network stints wins hands down with this upscale concept restaurant.  Fans are truly won over - at least this one and his wife, mom & daughter too!  Our Day After Christmas ambiance was cheerful and lively but not too loud. Dine in the back of the restaurant for intimacy, front for people watching and a big bar with TV's. You can also watch the kitchen operate closely from some tables in the middle of the room.  Our servers Tammy & Mark were attentive, knowledgeable and gracious.  Prices are standard (for high end Vegas eateries) between $15-$30 a plate.  Must Have Appetizers: Tomatoes & Burrata with sourdough toast Fried Eggs & Ham Warm salad   Must Have Mains: Shrimp with Spaghetti Squash Short Ribs & Mashed Potatoes   Must Have Deserts: ALL  Tip: Make your rez (like we did) and eat before 7PM to fully enjoy without the "packed & loud" scenario trendy restaurants unfortunately adopt.

I was able to visit this place during lunch about two weeks ago. It is a nice spot and can be hard to find if you are not sure where you are going. They have free valet parking during lunch  hour which is great.  This place look great! It is like you are entering someone's farm type home with big tables with non-matching chairs (which I love!)  The lunch menu is slightly limited and you cannot order anything off the dinner menu ( we tried and were politely turned down lol) I cannot remember what everyone else ordered food wise but I do know that they loved drink which I believe was called the Indian Summer. (everyone that ordered one had two before the day was over ) I had the sweet tea vodka and lemonade which was delicious. The best Arnold Palmer I have ever had that's for sure.   For lunch I ordered the spinach salad and added the blackened salmon. I had to actually as for a new piece of salmon because it was way to salty to eat. Now before people get on my case, I have had blackened salmon before and this was by far saltiest I have ever had. They were gracious enough to remake it without salt and it was perfect.   Make sure to order some of those yummy fries because they were ADDICTIVE! Our entire table were practically fighting over the last few bites of fries. I swear my coworkers are crazy!  I will definitely be back to try their dinner menu as it appears to be tapas. Plus it would be cool as a cozy date night!

Went here for dinner last night and while the meal was ok, I was underwhelmed over all. Service was super mediocre. Our server did the bare minimum and had no enthusiasm. We split: Cheddar Puffers: tasty, these were complimentary and packed a little heat that surprised me  Duck Fat Fries: ok, nothing to rave about  Caesar Salad: I wanted some greens so I knew this wouldn't be too exciting but I needed a salad. I asked for dressing on the side and the waiter said it is very lightly tossed in so I said ok, as long as it's light. It was drenched in dressing. Ugh  Short Rib: Best thing we ordered- delicious and very large portion  Squid: Our waiter recommended this and I thought it was awful. Hated the sweet and sour sauce and whatever they put on the side (tasted like cream cheese) made it worse. Just gross.  Manhattan Cocktail: My husband loved the Manhattans here- he can be pretty picky so I thought I'd make note of that :)

My wife and I recently went here and had a great time, great food, and great drinks.  She had the Fish & Chips and I had the Mussels.  The fish & chips presentation was really amazing and the broth from the mussels was so tasty.  I would have to say my favorite thing was the Old Fashioned that my wife suggested.  I've been looking for one ever since we got back.  I would love to stop by here again.  The service was great, very friendly.  Thank you all for a great experience.
Loved this place when it first opened. Ate there several times a week. Last time it looked  and tasted like cafeteria or airplane food.  Won't be returning.

We decided to try out this place. Overall it is a good place to enjoy a decent meal. Nothing spectacular but defiantly worth mention as they did have some uniqueness  and the atmosphere was good. None of the dishes we had were out of this world, but they were good and worth bringing people for a quick bite to eat either before hitting the town or a late night snack as they are open late!  We tried the squid which was a in a sweat and sour sauce very good and full of flavor. Next the short rib was ok. It lacked a little flavor.  We moved on to the shrimp and grits. I think I had high expectations for that dish and it just was lacking a little bit of spice to make that hold statement. The tartar I could have done without, but the pork with the egg was defiantly unique and I think a must!  For dessert you can't go wrong with sunday. They kept on mentioning the cookies with Milk  so we had them and let me just say stick to the sunday!

Everything was very good but nothing really blew me away. This may sound strange, but the food came out of the kitchen startlingly fast...almost as if they they didn't actually cook anything to order. The service was good and the decor was interesting.

I decided to try out their happy hour on Christmas eve and was pretty pleased.  The drinks were really good and the bar tender made sure to let me know the first one I wanted was not sweet and kind of strong.  Her service was really good and she checked in just the right amount of times. The fries were fantastic and everything a fry should be.  Crispy on the outside, nicely seasoned, and the sauce a compliment.  The fish tacos, however were not all that great and a little on the dry side.  They could have really done with a little sauce on them.  Still, I will give it another try.
Great menu, interesting pairings! I sat at the bar with friends, Phil was our bartender and was fantastic! Very attentive and made the atmosphere fun. Will definitely be back!

Have you eaten at Seersucker in San Diego, My wife and I were very happy to see the new location in Scottsdale.  The location is a little funky, but the food  and the vibe are both great.  It's not quite as hip as the San Diego location, but it has its own Scottsdale flair.  (Although the bloody knife artwork is a little creepy)  We tried a variety of foods and found everything to be very good. That said nothing really stood out as above and beyond, hence only the four star review.  I think Seersucker is a great addition to Scottsdale it would highly recommend if you haven't been there you give it a try.

I really really wanted to love this place. The marketing is so cool and I've been waiting for the opportunity to come sample the cuisine. A friend invited us to join him to see Mariah Carey at Caesars, so this was that opportunity! I was so excited.  The Pros - The marketing is cool. - The place looks cool. - We were serviced by 3 different guys and they were all very helpful and attentive! - We all agreed that the calamari was the best item we had.  The Cons - Poor Selection. I wasn't crazy about the menu items so much so that I ended up getting a salad. Getting a salad at a place as nice as Searsuckers is like going to Basking Robins & getting vanilla ice cream. - Duck Fat Fries. GROSS. If I were a fast food character, I would be The Fry Guy. The aftertaste of the 'duck fat' was gross. Seriously gross. I barely touched the dish, and even told the waiter that, well, they were gross, but he said that he loves them & he left them on the bill. Shannon & Scot were in agreement about the grossness. - Expensive. I don't mind having a crazy expensive dinner, but I just wasn't expecting it here. The Cesears website has it listed as $$ and Yelp has it as $$$.  My Cobb salad with shrimp was $34. My martini was $14, but the Apple Martini listed on the menu was $35. Hmmm. All in, we spent $235 for 3 people. I had a salad & fries, Scot only had an appetizer, Shannon had a caesar salad and we all shared the calamari.  For the record, Shannon & Scot rated Searsucker higher than I did. There are several locations nationwide, so I must be in the minority of disfavor. Maybe you will like Searsucker more than I did.

First time here. Happy Hour menu is limited (food wise), but the tuna poke was delicious! We ordered the duck fat fries and a slider (chefs choice, tonight was pork belly). All in all the food was good and the drinks are strong. Service was good (we sat at the bar) and the food came out quickly.

Fantastic food! We decided to do a bunch of small plates. Disclaimer: these are not small plates! Definitely over ordered by 3 plates! They are a really decent size. My favorites were the short rib, the spicy shrimp and grits, and the beef tartare (with quail egg yum). I also had a cocktail called the czar and the ballerina. A blueberry/vodka/cucumber water/soda concoction. So good, not sweet, perfection.

First visit to Searsucker in Caesar's Palace and it was a good experience overall. The servers were very friendly and kept an eye on our table to make sure drinks stayed full. The place has an open cafe feel to it which was nice given its location next to the Sports Book.  The menu was interesting and had some interesting appetizers that I'd go back to try. This time I had the Bone Marrow and it was excellent. The table tried the salmon and skirt steak which looked good. I felt like a salad and asked them to finely chop and toss the Cobb salad and it was also very good.   All in all a good place with friendly staff.

Good atmosphere, delicious food and great service.  We came here as a party of four and all new to this restaurant. We were greeted by a warm and welcoming server who explained some of the dishes, cocktails and what she recommended.   We started with a few cocktails including the Peter Rabbit and Bad Bad T-Roy Brown. I loved the Rabbit... I added the gin to it and it made for an easy to drink refreshing cocktail that was a little sweeter so the alcohol didn't overwhelm you. Definitely a hit.  As for the food, we ordered the kale and romaine caesar, potato fries, JP's chicken wings, jalapeno-chorizo corn, brussels & walnuts and eggs and bacon.   My favorites were the potato fries, corn and brussels. The fries were so delicious fried in duck fat! They were crunchy, salty and had more flavor then a regular french fry because of the oil. The chipotle ketchup they are served with was also good fit and we asked for an extra serving of it. The brussel sprouts were roasted with a nice char on them and were tossed in lemon and walnuts. I loved the extra crunch from the walnuts and the tangy zest from the lemon. I could have eaten the whole dish by myself. I felt the same about the corn, spicy and sweet. It's a dish I wouldn't normally order but I am glad we did.   We also had the pb & J dessert and chocolate s'more dessert. I think they were both hits but the preferred the s'mores.   We had great service, the dishes all came out in a timely manner one or two at a time which I appreciated so we could take our time and our table wasn't packed to the brim with dishes. Thanks for the experience Searsucker!

I have always loved every dining experience I've had at Searsucker whether it was the gaslamp, northern San Diego or Vegas location but this one in particular was my absolute favorite.   The food tasted more delicious somehow but could be courtesy of all the drinks I had which by the way, are incredible. I love spicy drinks and the jalaberry strawpeno was fantastic. We also got a bottle of wine and the Cabernet was probably one of the best I've ever had.   Appetizers:   Pork belly + egg: Get it. Don't even think about it. Just do it.   Mussels + chorizo: If you love mussels, you must get this. The small pieces of chorizo and sauce go so well together and the mussels are super soft.   Bone marrow: One of Searsuckers' rival (in my opinion) is Whiskenladle and I know their bone marrow dishes get compared all the time but honestly, they're totally different. Searsucker's bone marrow has some sweetness to it and the brussel sprouts that come with it tastes so good so don't skip it! It's not just decoration. Haha.   Entrees:  Tomahawk: If you are considering any of the red meat options, get this one. Let me say it again, GET THIS ONE. It's the most expensive thing on the menu but I promise it'll be the best ribeye you'll ever have. After the first bite, you won't even remember that it costs 85 dollars. And it's ENORMOUS. I always complain about 12 oz steaks being too small but our table of 3 meat loving girls couldn't finish it.   Filet + lobster sauce: This dish is great on its own but after having the tomahawk, it was really nothing special and that's saying something because it's delicious.   Brussel sprouts + walnuts: I don't even like brussel sprouts and thought this was SOOO good. So much flavor and doesn't taste like its a vegetable at all.   Deserts:   Smores bar: I'm not a huge fan of the smores combo but this one was different. Everything went together very well and the ice cream is amazing.   Milk + cookies: So simple yet SO good. They put sea salt on the cookies which enhanced the flavors and the cookies are so soft.   Now for the best part about our night, our server Chris was the best!!! How he managed to deal with 3 very exhausted but energetic and delirious dental sales girls is beyond me and I'm sure he is some part super human. He took such good care of us and really made our night super memorable. I would've given him a hug if it were appropriate to do that with your servers. Haha. If you could request to be sat in his section, I would definitely ask.

How great is this place?  We had a fun and memorable experience here the other night thanks to the servers and chefs!  No easy task with nine people (one of them my dad who ranks EVERY restaurant "marginal at best." Lol)  Our personal favorites were the quinoa, short rib and chocolate chip cookies. But honestly, everything was delicious.  It's always fun when the staff enjoys being there, nothing is a problem and the meal just flows.  Love the vibe and we will be back for sure!
Fun trendy restaurant with great food. Smalls are appropriately named. Luis our busboy was really knowledgeable and friendly! Great place, we've already recommended it to our friends!

I was on my annual trip to Las Vegas with the guys for the Super Bowl and made reservations to have dinner here on February 6, 2016.  Having become a foodie thanks to my wife, plus being a fan of Chef Brian Malarkey since his initial Top Chef contestant season I was excited to check out Searsucker.  Even with running a bit late, my friends and I were seated right away and greeted by our server Emily as well.  We ordered drinks and continued to review the menu to see what we wanted to eat.  I had the Big Eye Tuna with a side of Duck Fat Fries that was simply out of this world.  The tuna was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right with a nice shaved vegetable slaw to go with the dish.  The only thing that would have made the dish even more enjoyable for me was some wasabi to go along with it.  The duck fat fries were pretty tasty too as they had I believe pancetta bits and parmesan cheese sprinkled over them as well!  It was a different preparation than I have previously and enjoyable just the same.    One of my friends ordered the lollipop buffalo wings that were tasty as well and I was told that the blue cheese aioli was pretty awesome for the wings.  The other main courses that were ordered was the scallops and the filet steak.  Both of those entrees were just as delicious according to my friends.  The only way the experience would have been better is if Chef would have been at the restaurant and I would have been able to meet him in person!  I did Tweet to Chef on Twitter and he did like my tweet!!!  I hope to one day get to either of the locations in San Diego with my wife so that she is able to enjoy the incredible food!!!

I've had the pleasure of dining at Searsucker in San Diego and decided we could enjoy a nice romantic dinner at the Las Vegas location.   We sat down and was greeted nearly 10 minutes after. First started with the specialty cocktail "snake in the grass" which was a over priced mint lemonade. I took a few sips and pushed it off to the side hoping our server would realize that I was unhappy with the specialty cocktail. My wife had the Malbec.   Started with the bone marrow which was actually the best part of our meal. For dinner we both ordered the NY Steak. Medium Rare for Me and Medium for my wife. I got the corn side dish and she had the asparagus.   The best part of our main course was the asparagus. $59 per steak? The $7.77 steak at Hard Rock  is far more superior than this over priced crap we were served. It was rubber and had no flavor. It was the hardest steak we've cut into. Our server asked how our meals were. I responded with, "it's alright."  And that was the last time our server spoke to us until we asked for the check. We were clearly unsatisfied.  My specialty cocktail pushed to the side which was clearly full. Both our steaks barely eaten and pushed to the side. We asked for the check and he asked if we wanted to box it up. We said no. Not one question as to why we were unhappy with the meal.   Searsucker has failed with customer service and quality of dinner. Never again will we eat here. A kitchen nightmare. Thanks for ruining our lovely night.

The service was phenomenal, at least our server was. I can not give 5 stars or even 4 stars because of the executive chef. Stephen Lasale (I believe that was the name on his jacket) was literally the most rude person I have ever encountered in a restaurant. Stephen, who was in charge of all of the food leaving the kitchen, was consistently just speaking in a derogatory demeanor to each of his fellow co workers. Our table was seated directly next to the kitchen so you could hear everything he would say and see all of his expressions as well as how his co workers responded to him. We did ask the server what his issue was and from what we gathered, this is very common with him. The manager came over to the table and did tell us that he agreed with us and that he would appreciate a complaint in writing. I think that no matter what position you are working, customer service is the most important thing ...whether it is internal or external. Stephen, I think it's time to find a different profession.
Beautiful setup. Great service. Amazing food.  Good price point. Nice menu selection.  Very accessible location.
Great service, food was amazing! Coming from San Diego we were delighted to see a familiar spot located in the heart of Vegas. It did not disappoint.

Came in on Friday night without reservation and were seated right away. Nice staff and service. Had steak, octopus, bone marrow, Brussels sprouts, and bread pudding with ice cream for dessert. All was delicious. Also duck fat fries. Pricey but normal by Vegas standards.
Wow this place is good. I am a carnivore. This is the perfect sort of place for someone like me. The service is great too.
Amazing happy hour and burger. But, get here early because they only make 20 burgers a day!

Where do I even begin?! Searsucker in Las Vegas, NV has become one of my favorite restaurants! Located inside the beautiful Caesars Palace, Searsucker knows how to satisfy every type of craving you may have. The restaurant has a rustic new aged feel with a little romance added in. The best part of course is the food!  With so many options to choose from, I love to order from the "Smalls" portion of the menu. These dishes come big enough for your appetite but small enough so you can order more than one.  Lets start with one of my favorite dishes, the Duck Fat Fries. Can you say Heaven? These will blow your mind. Crispy on the outside (but not burnt) and a taste that is very different than your normal french fries, this dish is guaranteed to make you want more!  Another mouthwatering dish you MUST try is the Brie "Triple", Cranberry Jam and Cowboy Caviar. The flavor from the jam compliments the brie in a way that I can't describe. You get sweet, you get cheese and you get crunchy all in one dish.  A must try while in Las Vegas, Searsucker will take you on a flavorful ride that you won't want to get off of. Let's give a big round of applause to Celebrity Chef Brian Malarkey for bringing us, in my opinion, one of the best restaurants Las Vegas has seen in a while.  See my full review here: http://corkedandporked.com/2015/07/18/searsucker/

Food is so delicious!!! Can't go wrong no matter what you order! My boyfriend and I came for the first ti.e while in vegas and ordered the 8pz filet cooked to perfection and the sides we got were horseradish mash potatoes amazballs and the mac and cheese, all fabulous!! Our appetizers were the tacos and oysters, all so good!! So good we came back on our last night and tried there poke, Brussel sprouts, calamari and more oysters!! This place will definitely be a regular spot everything we visit vegas!! And we visit 1-2 times a year!

Very cool vibe, fun drinks, and a great bar where you can people watch all the folks lining up for Omnia if you're there on a Saturday night. We had already eaten dinner when we stopped in for a round of drinks, but the menu looked really impressive. We ordered a round, and the drinks were not out of control expensive (It's Vegas, so I'm typically expecting about $15-$20 for a drink depending on which casino you're in)... I got a really nice glass of NZ sav blanc for $13, and the specialty cocktails ran about $15 a pop. Will definitely return the next time I'm at Ceasar's Palace.

Well....the much anticipated #BrunchUnplugged was finally visited by me last Saturday!  It's no secret I'm a regular at Searsucker/Scottsdale, and a fan. So I was anxious to get to their new weekend brunch.  Of course I like the atmosphere, and the service, but under the guidance of Chef Aarti Sanghavi, the food was AMAZING.  Chef was introduced to me by the GM and the was the start of my brunch adventure.  I asked her what was good on the menu and she stopped me and said, "wait, what do you like? what do you not like?"  "forget the menu, I know my food and what you will like based on your tastes"  So the beginning of a great hour of food was upon me. Chef Aarti was not kidding in the least!  She began with the waffles, no not your mama's waffles, but waffles from the gods!  or at least Chef Aarti!  Scrumptious describes them! OMG the fois gras butter....really?  Delish!  She then presented me with the 'Green Eggs and Ham"  not quite what to expect, but the toasted brioche, pork belly, and poached egg were perfectly prepared!  Now the 'green' was a kitchen created chimichurri that absolutely made the dish perfect!!!!  As if that were not enough, next to the table was the 'chicken fried chicken'.  Yes a chicken breast filled with pork then deep fried and topped with Chef Arti's secret weapon gravy.  If I told you the recipe, she'd have to kill me!   I've not even touched on the bottomless Mimosa's either....! Let's not forget the live music that was energetic, soothing, but it did not interfere with the dining experience...yes LIVE MUSIC! You all owe it to yourselves to head to Scottsdale's Searsucker this weekend for their #BrunchUnplugged!!!

Not the kind of place I would normally go, but we visited Searsucker recently for a yelp party and I was actually very impressed with the food and service. The bartenders know their job very well and the wine selection is very good.   This is definitely one of those high-priced upscale places, but if that is what you're looking for, Searsucker manages to be elegant but not snobby.

5 stars for our server who patiently explained all of the specials and his recommendations from the menu (he definitely knows his stuff) and plus divided up the bill however many ways we wanted.  He definitely worked for his tip!   As far as the food itself, I would give it a 4 star rating.  Got the sword fish, which came with a side of sauce - chose the chimichurri (per our waiter's recommendation- great job) and a side of Brussels and walnuts, which were tangy and yummy.    My husband ordered the pork butt (which I hear is actually pork shoulders), plus the side of duck fat fries.  The fries were good, but we didn't feel like they were anything super special.  The butt was big and had a lot of meat in them, and they were thick and juicy.  Hehe.   It all came out about 140$ including tax and tip , and 2 speciality cocktail drinks we gave our friends who were celebrating their birthdays there yesterday.   Would come back again.

Searsucker has a great Happy Hour special from 5-7 pm, with beers costing around $5. This restaurant is conveniently located inside the Caesars Palace.   The decor is beautiful and the food was pretty decent too. My hanger steak was cooked to medium rare perfection!   The service was really nice and they were quick. They refilled the drinks consistently and was very friendly!

As foodies, we like to find interesting and new places to visit. After having been to Vegas a few times and exploring all types of restaurants, we came across Searsucker.  This was our favourite meal we've had in Vegas. The food was out of this world and definitely memorable.  Trust me when I say this... GO EAT HERE!!!

Brian Malarkey has joined the bandwagon of celebrity chefs and finally opened his own restaurant in Caesar's. Located right next to Omnia, the offerings aren't limited to seafood. Every Vegas restaurant has to offer steak and Searsucker is no different. But, I like some of the farm offerings as well including pork, chicken, and even rabbit. For Vegas standards, the entree prices are on par, but I see a lot of value in the small plates. We went with a large party for my friend's 30th birthday so we got to try a little bit of everything.   For starters, the cheddar puffers were as addictive as those crack cheddar biscuits from Red Lobster back in the day. Check-in on Yelp for a free serving of the habanero, coriander pickles. A word of warning, the pickles were delicious, but do NOT eat the habaneros (from experience). The roasted shishito peppers in ponzu were some of my favorites. The texture and flavor was almost like that of a shiitake mushroom. Of the small plates, the duck fat fries with chipotle ketchup was outstanding. The mussels were great too, but I didn't get much flavor from the beef tartare.   Seeing as Malarkey is known for seafood, I opted to get the mahi. The drunken cherries and smokey almonds outshined the actual fish. I could eat a whole bowl of just that sauce. The pork butt is another popular dish if you're not feeling the seafood. The desserts were great too and worth sampling. The "ermahgerd" sundae was delicious, but my favorite was the s'mores bar.   I would definitely come back for happy hour, which runs 4:30-6:00 pm. We ended up spending over $75 per person, which was pricey, but ended up getting us into Omnia for free to see Nicky Romero. You bypass the general admission line as well. Win!

Came here after seeing a show. Closes at 11pm on Wednesday. There's a free yelp check in for pickles and habanero. Yes, it's exactly as it sounds. WAY TOO SPICY for all us. Perfect if you love spice. To drink I got the when doves cry, which I guess is a homage to Prince. Drink was ok and so was service. Overall, place is just ok.

Came in with a friend, sat at the bar with zero wait. Bartenders name was Juice. Super knowledgable about all cocktails and the menu. Ended up getting a simple gin and tonic to drink. Ordered a few items from there small list. Hamachi was amazing but a little small, beef tartare was great and good size as well, muscles were huge portion and delicious. Over all great experience Juice gave us great suggestions and will definitely be returning to see him.

Good Food, fun appetizers, quick service and a delightful staff. We enjoyed cocktails and some apps before seeing a concert this weekend. The shrimp and grits were very tasty and had a nice kick to them, the complimentary cheeze puffs hit the spot and the waiter offered to give us to go cups for our cocktails. We were happy patrons! I would totally stop by again to eat a full meal the next time I'm in Vegas.

The server we had tonight was super sweet didn't get her name she had bangs though !! Too bad the hostess are pretty rude and unwelcoming. I've been to there SD location as well and it wasn't all that great. Thought I'd give it a shot again in Vegas. Probably the last time I'll be visiting this chain of restaurants. Not much of anything special. Especially since there service is average.

Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup - SPOT ON.  This was a creamy tomato soup and the grilled cheese was gooey white cheddar on a fantastic sourdough.  The two were in perfect proportion - not too much of one or the other.  I'm a simple girl and this was probably my favorite dish.  5/5  Calamari - chili honey glaze and apples.  Very tender and tasty.  The flavors were good and it was one of the best calamari dishes I have ever tasted - the meat was not even the slightest bit rubbery.  The waiter recommended this and it did not disappoint. 5/5  Charred Octopus - ginger, sesame and sour orange.  I would not recommend this dish - when they say charred they mean very charred.  We couldn't even eat the terminal end of the tentacle because it was like eating a crunchy stick. 2/5.  Roasted Cauliflower - pickled chilis, pine nuts, citrus.  Cauliflower is pretty much the only vegetable that I like and this one was TERRIBLE. Flavorless and almost slimy.  Do not recommend. 1/5.   Bone Marrow - fresno chili bourbon glaze.  Compared to the other items on the menu the price point for this was excellent at only $15 (at most restaurants the bone marrow is significanlty more expensive than the rest of the menu). It was good but as always a small portion.  5/5.  Came here on a Friday night with my coworkers while at a conference.  We were seated at the booth nearest the entrance so it was open to the casino area.  I actually don't recommend that exact location even though the booth itself was comfy and the perfect size to accomodate lots of food dishes while still permitting conversation.  However, we didn't really enjoy the ambiance of the restaurant because we didn't get the lighting and music because we were so exposed to the walkway.  However, overall I very much enjoyed the dishes and drinks at this location, besides the few misses as listed above.
Overpriced and didn't let us know until it was time to pay they couldn't split the check up. Server had a poor attitude

Came here for a group work dinner, the one in San Diego seemed to have better food. We ordered a little bit of everything and when asking the waitress how much to get and what to get she seemed to lack suggestions or portion size experience. Overall I'd might come back to this location, but I've eaten better in Vegas!

This is celebrity chef Brian Malarkey's foray into the Las Vegas food scene. The restaurant is divided into three sections and there's a bar area with eating/drinking overlooking the casino.   Four of us met for dinner and ordered a number of small plates, greens, and main courses.  We shared all items ordered and here's the list:  Egg and pork belly Short ribs Brie and cranberry jam Cowboy caviar Shrimp and grits Mushrooms and burrata Strawberry, champagne, walnut, and goat cheese salad Spinach, bacon, mushroom, and sweetbread salad Jalape√±o-chorizo corn off the cob Pork butt with whiskey apples and bacon emulsion Duck with white bean, confit, and fig Brussels sprouts and walnuts Mahi "baja" with drunken cherries and smokey almonds Apple crostata Ermahgerd sundae S'mores Pumpkin cake  While waiting for all four to arrive, two of us were given a container of cheddar puffs and more were brought when we were all seated.  We discussed what each found interesting on the menu.  The head chef joined us and explained the entire menu and he gave us some suggestions.  The outstanding items were the egg and pork belly, cowboy caviar, the strawberry salad, pork butt, Brussels spouts, egg and pork belly, and the mahi.  Of those items, the mahi was the best thing of the night.  The char and the perfect grilling of the mahi made it an incredible dish.  The cowboy caviar, a.k.a. bull testicle, was tender and had a light breading before frying.    The pork belly was quite thick but was tender and cooked well.  I was surprised at how much I liked the strawberry fris√©e salad.  The champagne dressing with the walnuts and goat cheese was very refreshing and tasty!    The pork butt was done nicely so that it was pull apart goodness.  There was a discussion about the Brussels sprouts.  I was very fond of this dish and I found the crisp char on the sprouts to be just to my liking.  My only disappointment was the brie with cranberry jam.  The brie had lost all flavor and it really needed the jam to give the dish some taste.  I'd skip this one.  As for dessert, we agreed the S'mores topped the others.  The menu describes the dessert as Graham + salted caramel ganache + honey chocolate mousse + marshmallow + chocolate ice cream + cookie crumble.  The Ermahgerd sundae was also good.  It's described as Peanut butter gelato + peanut coffee "rocks" + caramel+brownies + br√ªl√©ed banana.  The pumpkin cake and the apple crostata were also very good.  I think I could go back and have all five of the desserts but skip the 6th--cookies and milk--and I'd have had a memorable time!  Great ending to our feast!  Service was excellent.  Jeremy--our main server--came from the original Searsucker in San Diego and he was top notch in everything.  We were given clean share plates and utensils for each course.  Jeremy coursed our selections perfectly so we didn't get a whole lot at any one time.  Water was replenished often.  For a new place, they are really doing things well.  Plating was nicely done, the flavors are complex, and the textures are good.    I'll have to get back here if they put back on the menu the rabbit and wild boar chops that are listed online but have been removed from the printed restaurant menu.

Went with reservations for 7 of us ... Were seated promptly and our waiter Jeremy was a delight. He made several personal recommendations... and we were not disappointed... Loved loved loved this place... All the food we had was delicious! The poached egg and pork belly was amazing. I also had the loin filet with mushrooms and the Brussels with walnuts. Both were sooooo good. I'd give this place 10 stars if I could. Best food I've had in a long time. I will definitely return when I'm in Vegas again... Think I might even try the one in San Diego now!

We went here with my family before Absinthe! It was ahh-mazing.  The vibe of the place is a little nautical mixed with a little cabin woods.  I love the off white colors mixed with the accents of wood.  It was very relaxing yet vibrant- a perfect way to describe the food & the ambience.  Just go ahead and order the Jalaberry Strawpeno - You're welcome.   - If you love Calamari- you are required to try there Calamari Steaks. It will take you down a flavor road that you never knew existed.    - Lollipop wings are always a great idea at ANY of the Hakkasan Group restaurants.   - MAC & CHEESE - HOLY LORD ALMIGHTY........Just do it.   - Beer Braised Short Ribs so light and cooked to perfection.  The flavors on the short ribs will make you come back for more.   Thanks to the Searsucker staff for always doing a great job & answering all the recommendations. We will be back!

before searsucker opened in scottsdale, i dined at the one in downtown san diego and absolutely loved it! when i heard we were going to be getting one here, i was thrilled. i could finally have my peter rabbits anytime i wanted them!  i've probably been to the scottsdale location 5-7 times, and have loved everything i've eaten so far. you absolutely have to try the squid-it's like nothing i've ever eaten before. the pieces are huge and the dipping sauce it comes with is so good. i recently had the tomahawk and couldn't believe how delicious it was-and massive!   i also can't say enough about the entire staff and their commitment to service.  a few months ago, a good friend was throwing a birthday party for her husband and the restaurant we were supposed to go to cancelled on her the day of!  she called me in a panic and i recommended we try searsucker to see if they could fit us in last minute on a saturday night.  they were able to accommodate our party of TEN with absolutely no problems and the restaurant was packed that night! everyone in our party loved the food, service, and atmosphere.  the staff was so attentive and my friend couldn't have been happier with my recommendation.

I was brought to this restaurant by a local and promised some delicious food, I didn't realize my expectations were going to exceeded. This place was fantastic from the warm inviting atmosphere to the amazing food. Emily made some suggestions as to what my table should order and share, she was spot on and we all loved the food. Take my advice, if you don't know what delicious item to order just ask the friendly staff. If you are lucky enough to get Emily as your server she may just warm you milk and cookies desert as well. Thanks guys for the lovely evening.

Incredible! I loved everything about my visit tonight...the ambiance was welcoming and upscale, the service was impeccable (our server Gianna was professional, attentive, and so sweet), and the food was amazing...I highly recommend Searsucker. Thanks for a great experience!

I remember the days when restaurants in Vegas were cheap so you would come in and gamble!  Now, not so much.  Food was average.  The bone marrow was really sweet, not savory.  Both our entrees (short rib and steak) were low on flavor.  The mac and cheese delivered but when doesn't it?  The cocktails were something I could have made at home. Service was very attentive.  Reservation was needed and they sat us on time.

You are sooooooooooooooo yummy! All the apps were amazing, but the entree was a thumbs down. This could have almost been 5 stars. Portions are pretty big and service was good. Also even though I made reservations, they sat us at these very high tables by the bar. I am having a family dinner and it got super loud. I think it would have been better by the kitchen on regular tables.   I picked this place because it's inside the Cesar's Palace right by the sports bar and we were going to watch Celine Dion (amazing show btw-a must see!)  Now for the food:  spicy hamachi & avocado, fresno chili / cilantro / oil-comes in a jar. Was't too spicy, but the hamachi was fresh and goes well with the wonton chips  beef tartare & sourdough,capers / mustard / egg yolk-also comes in a jar with wonton chips. Perfect amount of seasoning.   blistered shishito peppers ponzu / sea salt-something I just love to eat so I have to always order this if I see it on the menu. Thumbs up  bone marrow* fresno chili bourbon glaze-i'm not a fan of bone marrow because it is too fatty for me, but this was amazing! best dish of the night. The crispy brussel sprouts that it comes with gives it that nice texture. Spread the bone marrow on the bread, top it off with the sprouts and some cilantro and you have the best thing you've ever eaten!   mussels* chorizo / chili / cilantro / corona-they give alot. make sure you dip the mussels in the broth to give it that extra flavor  duck fat fries-crispy and delicious.    beer braised short ribs,horseradish potatoes / crispy onions-this was their signature dish and it was so disappointing. Lacked flavor, was dry, and we told the waitress. She did offer to make a new one, but we were so full and didn't want another one.   Stick with the appetizers only!

We went for happy hour.  Great happy hour menu and prices.  We got the strawberry, walnut and goat cheese salad - excellent.  We ordered the short ribs, shrimp and grits and crabcake.  All were great.  Great atmosphere and drinks!

Fantastic food!! A little on the pricey side but well worth it. We had reservations for 6pm and had no problems. We all tried a different cocktail. I got When Doves Cry; the tequila was strong but it was tasty. Friend got the ballerina & the czar; it was spritzy, pink and tasted great. For food we ordered the duck fat fries, short ribs, and my favorite item, egg + bacon!! It was sweet and salty, delicious. And then the cheddar puffers! Wow. Desserts were also on point. We ordered the smores, banana bread, and the pj and jelly puff! So much great food! Our server was excellent. So happy we made the trip down to the strip!

After attending the Elite event at Seersucker, where everything was absolutely delicious, I knew that a return visit would be in the near future. So when Dyanna L. invited me to dine with her on a weekday evening I excitedly accepted.   Seersucker was rather empty when we arrived just a few minutes after our reservation, I chalk this up to happy hour having just ended. The service we received was excellent during this visit, attentive but never overbearing.   Dyanna and I shared all of the dishes we ordered, including the complementary cheddar puffers sent out by the chef. Here is a quick run-down of what we noshed on:  Brie appetizer - This dish featured made-in-house peach jam rather than the cranberry mentioned on the menu. So decadent, we joked that this could have been our dessert rather than our starter.   Cobb salad - We asked our server to help us pick between a couple of salads, and this was her recommendation. The bleu cheese, the roasted tomatoes, the bacon, the dressing...  everything melded together wonderfully.   Crab cake - The only item we ordered that we had during our previous visit. This crab cake has ruined all other crab cakes for me.   The Special for the evening - house made pasta with pesto, shrimp, mussels and a spicy tomato sauce. If this is ever an option on the menu or as a special, get it. The tomato sauce wasn't very spicy, you could taste the freshness of the pesto, and the pasta was cooked to perfection.   For dessert we had the lemon cheesecake, which was a lovely combination of tart and sweet.    After we ate we decided to stop for a drink in the bar area, where we were served by a bartender that was not only adorable but knowledgeable about the spirits. I ended up  having the Ballerina and the Czar, which the waitress warned would taste heavily of the cucumber water which was in it. I found it to be very refreshing.   Seersucker was a wonderful choice for our ladies night out, there was literally nothing that could have been improved upon during our visit. This will be my go-to spot the next time I have friends or family visiting that want good food in a somewhat casual setting on the Strip. I am also looking forward to taking advantage of the great happy hour prices in the very near future.

upscale, hip, trendy, and amazing food. Need I say more?  The enormous bar is a fantastic place to hang out before your table is ready. Get there early and have cocktails.   The food is very well prepared, elegantly presented, and can vary from simple to elegant. Don't be frustrated if you don't understand everything on the menu. It's meant to be 'interactive' so that the servers are encouraged to discuss the food with the clientele.  They have a pork dish with poached egg that must to tasted to be believed. Totally yummy!  Valet parking only; if there's self park, I can't figure out where.

My weekend dinner experiences with Searsucker have always been on point.  Although pricey and the service can get slow, Searsucker has always delivered on food.  Service 3.5/5 Their service is like Pizza. Even when it's bad, it's pretty good.  I've had some amazing experiences and other times where we had to find our server throughout the evening.  Everyone has always been consistently friendly with great vibes from previous visits.    Food 5/5  Everything I've tried at Searsucker has been a great experience.  Presentation and the quality of the dishes have always been top notch.  Here are some of my faves: Beef Tatare & Sour Dough: A Searsucker staple for me, the egg yolk brings this home   Tune Poke & Shaved Taro Root: Always fresh poke Lollipop wings: you heard that right, wings.  Their sauce is at another level, I'll order every time. Bone marrow: Just pure bliss and good times.  Highly recommended Beer Braised Short Ribs:  Ribs have always been tendered and very tasty. 36oz ribeye tomahawk: Fun to share, fun to eat and fun to share on social media  Value: 4/5  The Searsucker bill adds up quickly.  The "Jars & Sliced" dishes and sides are in the high teen price range and you're going to want to sample many.  Signature dishes and the grill stars around $30 and goes as high as $155 for the bomb 36oz ribeye tomahawk. The Signature dishes portions are very large.   Get ready to throw down some cash for a great and unique food experience  Ambiance: 4/5  It's a place to see and be seen when you dine here.  It's a very casual neo 1800s seersucker vibe with brick walls and lights hanging from ropes.  Every weekend dinner experience had people socializing at the table for long periods of time.  The dishes were designed to be shared so everyone is enjoying their food experience together.  This is a catalyst to socialize at the table, throw in some drinks (for us a lot) some music and you're having a great time quickly and the hours pass.    Expect to spend some money but bring your favorite foodie friends and/or drinking friends as you're going to be sitting down for awhile.  It's a great place to catch up over some great food in a loud but fun and social restaurant.  Expect to see some attractive people eating and pre-gaming before they hit up the Omnia nightclub next door.  I believe they still offer expedited entry (literally no wait) into Omnia if you spend a certain amount but verify with the restaurant.  It's the best and easiest way to get into Omnia if you don't have a host.   Enjoy...
Try the Ballerina cocktail! Refreshing and delicious! Went in for a few drinks with friends and we were very impressed with the food and customer service!

Omg! Me & My Husband went here for my Bday dinner we were walking around & we seen it,  looked like a bar? So we sat down very great customer service our waitress was awesome! !! Our food was more than amazing for appetizer we had spicy shrimp sauteed.  Then I had Salmon veggies side of mashed potatoes.  My Husband had the swordfish truly awesome here the chef made our food so good that everything we tasted after that point was nasty! So glad my birthday dinner was amazing! !!!

A friend and I came here to watch the premiere of The Taste last night and were very surprised at how empty the place was.  We were also lucky enough to be invited to an event here last week in which were able to try a few of their signature drinks, some of their "tastes", and a couple of their dishes.  The food was phenominal, and I cant wait to come back and have a regular portion of it all. As for last night, it was just drinks for us.  This place is beautiful. Lots of warm light, interesting artwork (both on the walls and light fixtures), and dark wood. The kitchen is  open so if youre seated near it you can watch the chefs in action. Overall this place feels very warm and inviting. Not a bad place to spend an evening by any means.  Our bartender Zach was great. He answered every question we had about the food and their speciality cocktails. He even gave us a little tatse of a couple ingredients to make sure we'd like the actual drink. So far Ive tried the Peter Rabbit, Lt. Dan, Latin Cinema (all at last weeks event), the La Floridita (YUM), and the Pear Tree. All of them are unique and delicious, and Im sure Zach and the other fabulous bartenders here can steer you in the direction of which would be best for you.   Unfortunately, their happy hour is only an hour and a half long (5-6:30 M-F) but if youre able to make it down for it, they have some of their tastiest bites on that menu.  I highly recommend this place for any occasion.

A last minute find by someone in our group turned out to be a great experience all around!  We all guess that it'll be impossible to get in so quickly in the not so distant future.    Great small plates- anything pork is bound to please.  Lively atmosphere and very friendly and attentive staff.    You won't go wrong here!
The bartenders and drinks were great.  The service at the bar was awesome.  I do know people sitting near the bar ca

Had dinner here with a large group recently, and while there was a lot to like, there were some issues as well. We were seated promptly upon arrival, and the space is definitely nice and comfortable. Drink orders were taken and delivered fairly promptly considering how busy the place was (Thursday evening dinner time).   After perusing the menu, we decided to get appetizers and spread them around; this netted us some tasty small plates. Among them, tender and flavorful lollipop wings, which featured a mild but distinct Buffalo style sauce with a delicious bleu cheese fondue for dipping. These were my go-to for the evening. Sliced calamari steak with chili honey glaze had a nice, thin breading giving way to a very tender and not at all rubbery interior; this dish was a major hit with the group. Another standout was the tuna poke and shaved tarot root; this featured a jar of deep red tuna poke with sesame seeds, onion, radish, and a little sriracha for heat, and was delicious on the crispy tarot chips. Unfortunately, an order of shishito peppers didn't make it to the table.  Things took a turn, though, when entrees were delivered. Me and another guest were sharing the bone-in New York strip, requested medium rare; it was delivered quite rare, well outside any notion of medium rare. This is difficult to forgive at this price point and service level. Upon letting our server know, she immediately requested a replacement from the kitchen, and while it was more properly cooked, it had also been pre-sliced, which seemed unusual to me. The flavor and seasoning were nice, but it put us a little out of step servicewise with our fellow guests.   Finally, we topped off the meal with a dessert that featured small ice cream cookie sandwiches; these were very good, with cookies that were fresh and decadent, and creamy ice cream that was very far from ordinary.   The service errors with the appetizer and steak, combined with cost, are what brings this review down. Other than the steak, the food items we received were very good, and I'd definitely eat here again.

Hungry on the Strip?...If you're at Caesars, stop here for a quick bite during HH.   Pros 1) We were able to get a seat in the bar area no problem during happy hour 2) Decor and ambiance were nice.  Bathrooms were clean 3) Our server was very prompt and friendly 4) Happy hour menu was decent... $9 bites from 5-7 daily.  $5 beers and $6 wines 5) Food was delicious! We had a few items from the happy hour menu and they arrived promptly and hot! Great quality and fresh!  Cons 1) Sliders only came with 2...They were too good to only get 2!

The food was pretty good but it's unfortunate that I wouldn't recommend this restaurant based on how the hostess treated me and my family. She had long blonde hair and her name was Nikki.  When we requested a table she stated the restaurant wasn't opening until 4minutes. Two parties right after us was seated immediately. All the Caesar affiliated restaurants cater to diamond players and even let you skip the line. It's such a pity that this hostess didn't have any manners regardless of what customers we were.   In addition, the waitress asked the manager to come speak to us but that was non existent.  On side note our waitress Tammie

Seersucker surpasses my expectations with a prefixed bachelor party meal.  The restaurant is located right next to Caesar's sports book.  The name implies Southern food, and I didn't see their normal menu although the food was actual culturally diverse.  Which I was good with as live in the South and didn't want southern food in Vegas.  We had two apps of hummus and himachi.  Both were decent.  The main course had options and I got something like skirt steak which was very good.  There were mashed potatoes and brusse sprouts to share.  I would have never visited just walking by, but I was pleased with my meal going in with less than high expectations.

Very disappointing.  In general, I felt the food was over seasoned and that always makes me think the restaurant is compensating for poor quality.  The service was prompt but the staff had zero personality.  Crab cake app - good amount of lump crab but the cake was basically burned on the top and bottom; I liked the side of sauce and tabasco pearls.  Side of bacon grits - Gross. The grits were a horrible texture...like overcooked oatmeal.  I could have cut them with a knife!  Also way too salty.  Side of Jalape√±o-chorizo corn off the cob - this was tasty but again was probably over spiced  Duck with white bean, confit, and fig - The meat was overcooked and incredibly  tough and the rest of the dish was bland.  I didn't even bother eating it.  It's Vegas, people.  Spend your money elsewhere.

Great decor, open kitchen, service and reflection of their original San Diego flagship.   Their branzino fish & chips dish was fantastic, as were the frenched chicken lollipops, vegan Thai curry and octopus.   Excellent experience and a good addition to Caesar's.

We just got home from a trip to Vegas for my 35th Bday! We were there for 3 nights so we tried many restaurants. I would have to say this was a favorite. The mixed cocktails are a must!!!!! We actually left the restaurant from dinner and then went back for a 2nd round later in the evening! Yum!

Located in Caesar's Palace, this amazing find rocked my socks off.   Ambiance: from chill at the bar (that has a ton of seating) to elegant dinner for two.  This place covers the spread and their Happy Hour specials are pretty cool too.   Service: excellent. I sat at the bar (party of one sadly) but the bar staff was a blast to chat with and quite knowledgeable about the menu.   Food: you MUST try the octopus ceviche! If you like octopus. The tuna poke also rocks my socks off but I'm partial to seafood ;) if you like habanero...you might want to try the habanero pickles! A bit of a bite but delicious.    No matter what you're hungry for this place has it. Steak, lobster, oysters, muddled, scallops, chicken, wings, fish tacos...the span of this menu is impressive and quite tasty.   If you're in Vegas and have some cash to spend...roll this way and check out Seasuckers!

Went here for the first time and will have to give it another shot.  The suggestions for the Prosciutto Salad, Sweet Corn App and Kobe Carpaccio and the Bone Marrow were awesome.  We had a few of the infused cocktails and they were all super amazing as well.  The Old fashioned is totally a great taste!  Our bartenders Jillian (sp) and Roberto were formal, informative and gave some great suggestions.  The atmosphere is cowboy western motif meets modern art.  The portions are sized appropiately for the apps and to get something started but it is a bit on the pricier side.  I'll be back for entrees!  I love the concept for the bar and lounge and will totally come in for a late night snack or cocktail with a group of friends for sure!

Loved every single second of being in this restaurant. The service was great, it was great d√©cor and the food was delicious. Get the shrimp and grits, you will not regret it. Another can't miss is the brussell sprouts side, such awesome flavor. Searsucker also looks like an amazing place to have an event like a rehearsal dinner or a trendy special occasion restaurant. Will most definitely be back.

I emailed both the address on the website and the Facebook page and got no response about our most recent visit.  I had dinner with my wife and her parents (in town from Cleveland) 2 Saturdays ago. It was my third trip to Searsucker and I have typically enjoyed the restaurant.  On this recent trip it was a little disappointing for two reasons. First, we made a reservation for 7:30pm and when we arrived we were told that things were running behind and would have to wait for 20 minutes. They suggested we wait at the bar, however, there were no spots available for us in either the bar or the lounge.  I understand that Searsucker is a popular place and I am glad that you guys are busy, it was just disappointing to be delayed when we made a reservation.  The next issue is a little more significant. My favorite dish on the menu is the chicken and waffles. I order this every time I am in the restaurant. On that Saturday night we order two of them (along with a slew of other appetizers) to share at the table. The waffles on both plates were burnt. I mentioned this to the waiter and he took them away. The surprising part is what happened next. He came back to the table and said that all of the waffles were like that. I asked how that could be and that is when I learned that the waffles are all premade earlier in the day.  I have never managed a kitchen and I understand that it is probably very challenging with workflow and time frames, however, a small waffle iron can turn out a waffle in 2-3 minutes. Also, it is extremely disappointing that the chef took a look at those waffles, saw that they were burnt and then still said that they were okay to serve to everyone that evening. Is there no quality control in the kitchen?  Looks like I will be finding a new favorite dish on the menu since the idea of premade waffles isn't that appetizing.

I'm a complete sucker for Searsucker!! Unbeknownst to me I've eaten at the Searsucker location in San Diego, but that experience failed in comparison to the one I had here in Vegas. Let me begin by saying the staff and their customer service was on point!! Shout out to Adrian and Phil who made our dinning experience at bar top absolutely awesome!! Every staff member we spoke with, whether they took an order, dropped off food, or simply checked on us was super friendly and pleasant. Kudos to the Hiring Manager.   Now for the scoop on the food...ahhh the delicious food. I tried three entirely different "Smalls" aka appetizers:   The calamari was a thicker cut, almost steak like, sans tentacles. I really appreciated how meaty and satisfying it was. If you're a calamari fan this is a must try.   My favorite dish of the night was the Mussels and Chorizo. Talk about mouth watering flavor. Thick cut cubes of chorizo marry perfectly with the fresh mussels to great the BEST tasting broth I have EVER eaten. I swear you could drink the broth as a soup.   The third app I devoured was the Mushrooms and Burrata on Texas Toast. As someone one who LOVES mushrooms and cheese this was my dream come true. Although it was a tasty dish, I was so obsessed with the mussels that it fell kinda flat it terms of flavor.   I decided to wet my whistle with their signature Ballerina and the Czar cocktail. It was light and refreshing. I think because it is mixed with cucumber water and because I chose to sip it slowly the ice melted which made the drink taste super watered downed, but my new friend Adrian added a splash of Sprite (per my request) which brought it back to life.   Overall it was a GREAT dinner/evening out. I will certainly be returning to sample more delicious dishes and to check out there pretty stellar Happy Hour menu!! You got me Searsucker and I'm not at all mad at you!!

I really felt like a sucker because I couldn't find this place! Luckily, when I called the hostess, she was able to tell me how to get there. For anyone who doesn't know where it is, Searsucker is tucked between Neiman Marcus and a bank. The parking is kind if ridiculous, so park at the mall if you get a chance. It isn't a far walk and you might need a walk after all the delicious food you eat!   The front entrance is spectacular. It's a large wooden door that seems foreboding like great castle doors, but also beckoning like a siren calling you to your delicious doom. The inside is spacious and has some interesting d√©cor. Ropes hang from the ceiling, like fishermen ropes entwined with the lights. Giant food related pictures hang (or are painted) on the walls. One is a large knife with ketchup (blood?) and another is a roasted chicken on a spit with a live chicken's head. (This one kind of disturbs me...) The bar is huge and wraparound style for easy access. The dining area has plenty of tables for an intimate gathering or a large one.   My husband really liked the spicy shrimp and bacon grits, while I really liked the squid "sweet heat" (calmari steak with sweet sauce). I also really enjoyed the Peter Rabbit cocktail. We'll definitely be back!

I met a group of friends here and even though I knew from checking it out online that the menu didn't offer healthy or veg options, I went for the company.  Unfortunately, my group had a waiter who was in a really bad mood.  He inherited our table when our first server left, but then he neglected us and when we had two additional arrivals who wanted to order food, he acted extremely annoyed once we flagged him down.  We were shocked and slightly amused by our server's strange behavior (glaring at us one moment, then rolling his eyes or avoiding eye contact when he walked right past our table with his nose in the air while we were trying to get his attention), but it didn't help make a good first impression.  Finally, we flagged down the manager who apologized, brought our check, and told us our server was just really busy.    The interior is cool - nice blue water glasses and mix-matched furniture.  The menu isn't as creative as they think it is and the (first) waiter described the dishes with much more creative flare than they came out of the kitchen with.  Our table tried a little bit of everything and if you eat meat and heavy cream/sauce/oil, you might like this place's food.  I think one of the meat-eaters in my group of 7 was happy with her meal.  If you don't want your veggies fried and/or covered in cream your options are to eat lettuce or take apart a dish.  I ordered saut√©ed mushrooms upon the first server's recommendation, which were good, but I wouldn't go back for them, even if the company was good - there are too many other awesome restaurants.  Plus, the sangria wasn't very good (watered down red wine and sprite?) - it needs some kick.
Fancy place. Perfect for a nice date or a birthday dinner. Never packed, but still in a great area. Close to old town.
Jen, was amazing! She took care of all our needs l, remembered our names, and ensured our experience was next level

Wandering around on our first night in Vegas during the July 4th holiday. We passed by this place and found it look interesting and decided to give it a try! We got a bone marrow plate and mussels. Food is a bit more on the greasy side. The most refreshing dish turned out to be the appetizer we got! spicy hamachi & avocado. SO. GOOD. and it's fun to eat too! Service was very fast and our waiter was very friendly!

Good quality, little quantity.  I don't write many food reviews, but I felt I needed to for this place.  I attended a dinner party with ten plus people.  The ambience was great and the staff very friendly and helpful.  The menu is not only unique but really tempts one to try non-traditional plates, such as mountain oysters or tongue.    The reason for 3/5 stars is the quantity of the food provided.  It's really good and flavorful (I had beef loin), but the portions are small - so small that you leave hungry. (I am medium frame man).  I found myself eating a lot of bread to compensate.  For the price of an individual dinner plate, I can say I don't think the place is worth it.   I would not recommend it to anyone I know.

Friendly staff. But the food is not unlike TGI Fridays or Chili's. And even that wouldn't be a big deal but the kitchen couldn't manage to get food out at the same time. Not sure what the problem is but when you order appetizers and lunch and the order of delivery is: Lunch 1, then Lunch 2 five minutes later, and THEN the appetizer, something is going wrong. Not impressed.
Service here was terrible. Bartenders were incredibly rude and unresponsive. Asked for happy hour items and got a bill for normal priced items that the bartender claimed I ordered. No thanks.

Had the drunken skirt steak and duck fat fries. Both were delicious... the steak was cooked perfectly for medium rare and fries were just amazing. Went with a large group of friends and no one had any complaints about the deliciousness of the food. If you go be sure to ask for an omnia chip that admits one to the Express line for club omnia right next door.

I've always wanted to check out the Searsucker in San Diego, but somehow ended up in the Scottsdale location first.  There were a few misses, but nothing major with the exception of the super salty salad.  It was a total disaster.  Here are a few other dishes we ordered:   Farm Bird Lollipops  Essentially meatballs with buffalo wing sauce.  The flavor and texture weren't bad, but a little boring.  I was expecting something more exotic with the name.  Salmon "Scottish"  Nicely cooked and seared, but the salmon was a little on the salty side.    Squid "Sweet Heat"  Probably the best calamari I ever had.  It was super tender.  The spicy sweet sauce gave a nice kick, but not overwhelming.   Even though the place was nearly empty, the atmosphere was welcoming with friendly staffs.  Some of the dishes were a little disappointing, but I am willing to give Searsucker a second chance in San Diego.

Tammie  One of my favorite experiences in Vegas... Let's start with the basics... Food - EXCELLENT Service - EXCELLENT  Value - GOOD D√©cor - Rustic/Sophisticated Hubby and I went in for Happy Hour (5-7pm daily). We arrived around 5:30 and found a table top by the bar. We started off with a Springtime Collins from the HH cocktail menu ($8). Very refreshing and a great start to our meal. We ordered a few items of the HH menu and regular menu (everything looked delicious, I would have ordered one of everything if I could have).  1/2 dozen oysters (reg. menu $3/ea), which happened to be from Washington, HH Tuna Tacos ($9), HH Shishito Peppers ($9), and the Bone Marrow (reg menu $19). Everything was tasty! I'm used to only seeing green shishito peppers but this order came with red and green, very colorful and well-seasoned. The bone marrow was excellent! Pure indulgence. Topped with crispy brussel sprout leaves and served with bruschetta toast to be devoured with the melty buttery marrow goodness. Highly recommend.   And then we have the dessert... WOW! First of all, everything on the dessert menu looks delicious, so you better save room. We ordered the s'mores bar served with a scoop of chocolate ice cream and I would have regretted it if we didn't. Perfect balance of marshmallow to silky honey chocolate mousse to chewy graham cracker base. I usually find many desserts too sweet and I couldn't keep my fork away from this thing. A must order.   And finally... the service, absolutely excellent. Our server Tammie (Tammy?)  was amazing. She knew everything on the menu, in detail, and had a great attitude. One of my favorite experiences in Vegas. Will be back on our next visit for sure.   P.S. I've been to their location in San Diego and it was just as amazing! Praying for a Seattle location!!!
Amazing place to grab a bite or dinner. The small plates are unique each with a twist and good portions. The cocktails are good as well.

I recently went to Vegas and Searsucker gave us the BEST meal! I still can't stop thinking about it.. drool. My friend and I split a few items: we started with the Field Greens & Pear Salad and added chicken, and it was almost like rotisserie chicken - super fresh and juicy. We also had the Shrimp Scampi (it comes with spaghetti squash) and Brussels & Walnuts. We felt like our items were super satisfying and generally healthy without being bland. Also not too overpriced compared to most places on the Strip! I'll be back! (*said in Arnold voice*)

I wish I could give 3.5 stars.   I was really excited to try Searsucker and then left feeling a little underwhelmed. First of all, the space is HUGE and was virtually empty when we went--which was pretty strange as the chef had won The Taste that very week. We ordered two cocktails and five small plates. The cocktails, though accompanied by stellar descriptions, were a bit flavorless (Snake in the Grass in particular). Some of the tastes on the small plates were GREAT (scallop with bacon and caramel...heavenly, duck fat fries--a great treat) but mostly I left wanting just a bit more.
This is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to, hands down. The hanger steak is to DIE for. Amazing atmosphere as well. Well done.

The service here is outstanding.  Not sure what some of the other reviewers are complaining about.  Probably picked on as a child and now they take it out on waiters and waitresses.  We were checked on by the manager multiple times and we even met Brian personally.  Everyone was very professional and the food was amazing.

I had a great time here, but more importantly a very good meal and fabulous libations.  The most applicable description of the atmosphere is the cringe worthy clich√©: rustic elegance.  Comfortably large but still maintaining intimacy, with loungey leather sofas in the entry, large distressed wooden dining tables, and large, statement-making crystal and rope chandeliers hanging from the high ceilings. I dined here with a bunch of raucous early 30-year olds for girl's night out, and Searsucker definitely proved an excellent choice for such an occasion.  I was happy to encounter a diverse age group of sharply dressed folks ranging from 20-60 during dinner.  It should be noted that once 10pm comes around, a DJ emerges, the atmosphere takes a fun switch to a nightclub vibe, and the mean age definitively shrinks. The food was very good.  The menu leans itself to mostly small plates, which is a good thing because the dishes are exceptionally rich (think Rokerij).  We tried a bit of everything, and everything was indeed a hit with the ladies.  The drinks are not cheap, but well-prepared and worth the outlay.  These delicious cocktails might lean a bit on the girly side, but gentlemen fear-not: their beer selection is robust.

I've been a big fan of Searsucker in San Diego so it was a treat to see it pop up in Las Vegas - started with 3 rounds of the addictive cheddar puffers, loved the ponzu shishito peppers and was really happy with the spicy tuna tartar

My friends and I stumbled in here through our adventured on the strip, and across the board we were all very pleased. The beef tartar was absolutely delicious and the free habanero pickles that we received from checking in with yelp were great too. For our dinners my friends ordered the beer braised short ribs which came with fantastic mashed potatoes,  the braised pork butt, a few salads and I personally ordered the Seersucker burger. The burger was one of the best of recent memory for sure, a little salty but over all delicious. If you are looking for a place to grab a bite, check them out.

restaurant is now open in Scottsdale. The first Searsucker restaurant opened in 2010 in San Diego by Bravo's Top Chef, Brian Malarkey, and Brian has recently opened a Searsucker in Scottsdale as well.  Located on the northwest corner of Camelback and Goldwater, Searsucker has taken over a 9,500 square foot space inside an office building. Large, inviting, rustic, yet classy is how I would describe the decor upon first entering. Large planks of rustic wood cover the windows and walls, the high ceilings with lights draped in thick rope offer the perfect dim lighting, and the rustic style wood tables lend a boat-like appeal, while a few couches and chairs fill the middle of the space lending a loungy area as well. The square bar near the front has plenty of space to enjoy hand-crafted cocktails and food, while the dining room seats approximately 150. The music is fun and upbeat which keeps the mood high as well. And the service that evening couldn't have been more attentive, friendly or helpful.  On to the menu! Executive Chef Malarkey's menu is both serious and fun, with dishes divided into categories like, 'Bites,' 'Greens,' 'Ocean,' 'Ranch,' 'Farm' and 'Ands'. The waiter first delivered our bread to the table, which they call cheddar puffers. These delectable little balls of joy were similar to the cheddar biscuits at Red Lobster (c'mon, who doesn't know about and love those), only these were pumped up on steroids a bit. Yum! Then, sticking to my usual regime of ordering as much food to taste as possible, I always must try the mussels whenever on a menu. These mussels were served with chorizo and toast ($12). The chorizo added a nice flavor in every bite. Next, the egg and bacon "pork belly" small plate ($12). This is the kind of dish that you might make inappropriate faces while eating, it's that good. We also tried a tuna tartar that night as well, served with wonton chips ($12). And of course, we had to order a dessert as well, which included peanut butter ice cream, nuts and caramel. Um, HELLOOOOO! Delicious.  Offering a full bar and a decent wine menu, this is not only a great place to start for happy hour, but a fun place to dine with friends or a date.
